10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt.effect: Pikachu-exclusive Z-Move. High critical hit ratio.
10,000,000 Volt Thunderbolt.detailed_effect:
10, 000, 000 Volt Thunderbolt is an Electric type Z-Move exclusive to Cap Pikachu . It is used with Thunderbolt .

10, 000, 000 Volt Thunderbolt deals damage and has a sharply increased critical hit ratio ( 1/2 instead of 1/24 ).

Absorb.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on opponent.
Absorb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Absorb turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.
Absorb.detailed_effect:
Absorb deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root , the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze , the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Absorb.secondary_effect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

Accelerock.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Accelerock turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.
Accelerock.detailed_effect:
Accelerock deals damage and has high priority.

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

Acid.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.
Acid.detailed_effect:
Acid deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Acid.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

Acid Armor.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid Armor turns into Z-Acid Armor and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Acid Armor.detailed_effect:
Acid Armor raises the user's Defense by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Acid Downpour.detailed_effect: Acid Downpour is the Poison type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

structuredEffects.note: Z-Move

Acid Spray.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acid Spray turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.
Acid Spray.detailed_effect:
Acid Spray inflicts damage and lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Acid Spray.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Special Defense two stages.

Acrobatics.effect: Stronger when the user does not have a held item.
Acrobatics.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Acrobatics.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acrobatics turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 100.
Acrobatics.detailed_effect:
Acrobatics deals damage, however, if the user is not holding an item, its power doubles to 110 .

If the user is holding a Flying Gem , it is consumed before the Pokémon attacks, so it receives both boosts and increases Acrobatics' power to 143 (or 165 in Generation 5 ). Once the Gem is consumed Acrobatics' power for the rest of the battle will be 110.
Acrobatics.secondary_effect: Increases damage by 100% if user is not holding an item.

structuredEffects.condition: User is not holding an item

Acupressure.targets: Targets either the user or an adjacent Pokémon on the user's team.
Acupressure.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Acupressure turns into Z-Acupressure and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Acupressure.detailed_effect:
Acupressure raises a random stat - Attack, Defense, Speed, Special Attack, Special Defense, Accuracy or Evasion - by two stages. It will always choose a stat that is not already maximized.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Acupressure is unlike other status moves in that it can be targeted at itself or an adjacent teammate. It cannot be used on an ally if they are behind a Substitute , but the user can apply Acupressure to itself if behind a Substitute.
Acupressure.secondary_effect: Raises one of the user's stats randomly by two stages.

structuredEffects.note: Raises a random stat (Attack, Defense, Speed, Sp.Atk, Sp.Def, Accuracy, or Evasion)

Aerial Ace.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Aerial Ace.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aerial Ace turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.
Aerial Ace.detailed_effect: Aerial Ace deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Aeroblast.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Aeroblast.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aeroblast turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 180.
Aeroblast.detailed_effect:
Aeroblast deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor , or those under the effects of Lucky Chant , are protected against critical hits.
Aeroblast.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

After You.effect: Gives target priority in the next turn.
After You.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, After You turns into Z-After You and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
After You.detailed_effect: After You forces the target to attack first in the next turn. It can be targeted at opponents or team-mates.
After You.secondary_effect: Target moves immediately after the user

structuredEffects.effect: Target moves first in the next turn

Agility.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Agility turns into Z-Agility and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Agility.detailed_effect:
Agility raises the user's Speed by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Air Cutter.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Air Cutter turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.
Air Cutter.detailed_effect:
Air Cutter deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor , or those under the effects of Lucky Chant , are protected against critical hits.
Air Cutter.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Air Slash.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Air Slash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Air Slash turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 140.
Air Slash.detailed_effect:
Air Slash deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

All-Out Pummeling.detailed_effect: All-Out Pummeling is the Fighting type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Alluring Voice.detailed_effect: The user attacks the target using its angelic voice. This also confuses the target if its stats have been boosted during the turn.

structuredEffects.note: Only if opponent had stats boosted during this turn

Ally Switch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ally Switch turns into Z-Ally Switch and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Ally Switch.detailed_effect: Ally Switch swaps the user with its teammate. In triple battles the user must be on either end, not in the middle.
Ally Switch.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Ally Switch.secondary_effect: Switches place with other Pokémon on field

structuredEffects.effect: User switches with an adjacent teammate
structuredEffects.note: Success rate decreases with consecutive uses

Amnesia.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Amnesia turns into Z-Amnesia and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Amnesia.detailed_effect:
Amnesia raises the user's Special Defense by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Amnesia.secondary_effect: Raises user's Special Defense two stages.

Anchor Shot.effect: The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee.
Anchor Shot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Anchor Shot turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.
Anchor Shot.detailed_effect: The user entangles the target with its anchor chain while attacking. The target becomes unable to flee.

Ancient Power.effect: May raise all user's stats at once.
Ancient Power.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ancient Power turns into Continental Crush and has base power 120.
Ancient Power.detailed_effect:
Ancient Power deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising all the user's stats at once - Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed - by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Ancient Power.secondary_effect: May raise all user's stats one stage.

Apple Acid.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Sp. Def one stage

Aqua Cutter.detailed_effect: Aqua Cutter deals damage and has an increased critical-hit ratio.

Aqua Jet.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aqua Jet turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.
Aqua Jet.detailed_effect:
Aqua Jet deals damage and has a priority of +1.

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

Aqua Ring.effect: Restores a little HP each turn.
Aqua Ring.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aqua Ring turns into Z-Aqua Ring and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Aqua Ring.detailed_effect:
The user of Aqua Ring surrounds itself with a veil of water, which restores 1/16 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn.

If the user is holding a Big Root , Aqua Ring restores 30% more HP each turn - approximately 1/12 of its maximum.
Aqua Ring.secondary_effect: Recovers 1/16th of user's HP each turn

Aqua Tail.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aqua Tail turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 175.
Aqua Tail.detailed_effect: Aqua Tail deals damage with no additional effect.

Arm Thrust.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Arm Thrust turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Arm Thrust.detailed_effect:
Arm Thrust hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Arm Thrust is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Arm Thrust to always hit the maximum number of times.
Arm Thrust.secondary_effect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

Armor Cannon.effect: Lowers user's Defense and Special Defense.
Armor Cannon.detailed_effect:
Armor Cannon deals damage, but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense stats by one stage each after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Armor Cannon.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Defense & Special Defense stats by one stage.

Aromatherapy.effect: Cures all status problems in your party.
Aromatherapy.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Aromatherapy.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aromatherapy turns into Z-Aromatherapy and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Aromatherapy.detailed_effect: Cures all status problems in your party.

Aromatic Mist.effect: Raises Special Defense of an ally.
Aromatic Mist.targets: Targets an adjacent Pokémon on the user's team.
Aromatic Mist.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aromatic Mist turns into Z-Aromatic Mist and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Aromatic Mist.detailed_effect:
Aromatic Mist raises the Special Defense of a teammate by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Aromatic Mist.secondary_effect: Raises ally Pokémon's Special Defense one stage.

Assist.effect: User performs a move known by its allies at random.
Assist.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Assist turns into Z-Assist and becomes the Z-Move for the move selected (for example All-Out Pummeling if Brick Break was chosen), in addition to its usual effect as above.
Assist.detailed_effect:
Assist uses a random move known by any of the user's party Pokémon.

Assist will not select a Z-Move or any of the following moves:

Assurance.effect: Power doubles if opponent already took damage in the same turn.
Assurance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Assurance turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.
Assurance.detailed_effect: Assurance deals damage, and if the target has already taken damage in this turn its power doubles to 120.
Assurance.secondary_effect: Doubles damage if target has already received damage this turn.

structuredEffects.condition: Target has taken damage this turn

Astonish.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Astonish turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.
Astonish.detailed_effect:
Astonish deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Astral Barrage.effect: The user attacks by sending a frightful amount of small ghosts at opposing Pokémon.
Astral Barrage.detailed_effect: The user attacks by sending a frightful amount of small ghosts at opposing Pokémon.

Attack Order.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Attack Order turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 175.
Attack Order.detailed_effect:
Attack Order deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor , or those under the effects of Lucky Chant , are protected against critical hits.
Attack Order.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Attract.effect: If opponent is the opposite gender, it's less likely to attack.
Attract.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Attract turns into Z-Attract and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Attract.detailed_effect:
Attract causes Pokémon of the opposite gender to become infatuated. Infatuated Pokémon have a 50% chance of being immobilized by love each turn and unable to attack.

Attract will fail on Pokémon of the same gender, genderless Pokémon and those with the ability Oblivious . Mew and Cryogonal can learn Attract via TM despite being genderless, however, the move will have no effect.
Attract.secondary_effect: Causes the opponent to be inflicted with Infatuation

structuredEffects.note: Only affects opposite gender to user

Aura Sphere.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Aura Sphere.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aura Sphere turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.
Aura Sphere.detailed_effect: Aura Sphere deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Aura Wheel.effect: Changes type based on Morpeko's Mode.
Aura Wheel.detailed_effect:
Aura Wheel deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage. It is the signature move of Morpeko , and its type changes based on Morpeko's form: Electric type in Full Belly Mode, or Dark type in Hangry Mode.

If the move does not succeed for any reason (e. g. the opponent protected against it or the Electric version was used against a Ground type Pokémon), the user's Speed is not raised.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Aura Wheel.secondary_effect: Raises user's Speed by 1 stage. Changes type to Dark-type if user is in Hangry Mode

Aurora Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aurora Beam turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.
Aurora Beam.detailed_effect:
Aurora Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Aurora Beam.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Attack one stage.

Aurora Veil.effect: Halves damage from Physical and Special attacks for five turns.
Aurora Veil.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Aurora Veil.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Aurora Veil turns into Z-Aurora Veil and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Aurora Veil.detailed_effect: Aurora Veil halves damage from Physical and Special attacks for five turns. It can only be used during hail or snow, but the effects continue if the weather changes or subsides.
Aurora Veil.in_depth_effect: This move will put up a protective barrier that will reduce the damage inflicted by attacks by 50% in Single Battles, and 33% in Double Battles. It can run in conjunction with Reflect and Light Screen but does not stack. It can only be activated during Hail, but will continue if Hail ends during its time. The ability Infiltrator ignores its effects
Aurora Veil.secondary_effect: Lowers damage from Physical & Special moves for 5 turns

Autotomize.effect: Reduces weight and sharply raises Speed.
Autotomize.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Autotomize turns into Z-Autotomize and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Autotomize.detailed_effect:
Autotomize raises the user's Speed by two stages and reduces its weight by 100kg (to a minimum of 0. 1kg). Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Decreasing weight affects these moves:

The effect of the weight change cannot be Baton-Passed (but the Speed change is passed as normal).

Avalanche.effect: Power doubles if user took damage first.
Avalanche.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Avalanche turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.
Avalanche.detailed_effect: Power doubles if user took damage first.
Avalanche.secondary_effect: Power doubles if user was hit before using the Attack.

structuredEffects.condition: User was hit earlier this turn

Axe Kick.effect: May confuse opponent. If it misses, the user loses HP.
Axe Kick.detailed_effect: May confuse opponent. If it misses, the user loses HP.
Axe Kick.secondary_effect: May confuse the opponent. If the move misses, the user takes 50% damage

Baby-Doll Eyes.effect: Always goes first. Lowers the target's attack.
Baby-Doll Eyes.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baby-Doll Eyes turns into Z-Baby-Doll Eyes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Baby-Doll Eyes.detailed_effect: Baby-Doll Eyes lowers the target's Attack by one stage, with increased priority.
Baby-Doll Eyes.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Attack stat one stage

Baddy Bad.detailed_effect:
Baddy Bad deals damage and reduces damage from Physical attacks by 50%, for 5 turns (similar to Reflect ).

Baddy Bad is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble , Buzzy Buzz , Sizzly Slide , Glitzy Glow , Sappy Seed , Freezy Frost , and Sparkly Swirl .

Baneful Bunker.effect: Protects the user and poisons opponent on contact.
Baneful Bunker.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baneful Bunker turns into Z-Baneful Bunker and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Baneful Bunker.detailed_effect:
Baneful Bunker prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Baneful Bunker user on that turn, the attacker becomes poisoned. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. The effects do not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities.

The accuracy of Baneful Bunker drops by 1/3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect , Detect , Endure , Wide Guard , Quick Guard , Spiky Shield , or King's Shield .
Baneful Bunker.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Baneful Bunker.secondary_effect: Inflicts Poison if target makes physical contact

structuredEffects.note: Success rate decreases with consecutive uses
Only if attacker makes physical contact

Barb Barrage.effect: May poison opponent; inflicts double damage if the target is already poisoned.
Barb Barrage.detailed_effect: Barb Barrage deals damage and has a 50% chance chance of poisoning the target. If the target is already poisoned, its power is doubled.
Barb Barrage.secondary_effect: Doubles damage inflicted if target is Poisoned

Barrage.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Barrage turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Barrage.detailed_effect:
Barrage hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Barrage is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Barrage to always hit the maximum number of times.

Barrier.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Barrier turns into Z-Barrier and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Barrier.detailed_effect:
Barrier raises the user's Defense by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Baton Pass.effect: User switches out and gives stat changes to the incoming Pokémon.
Baton Pass.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Baton Pass turns into Z-Baton Pass and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Baton Pass.detailed_effect: Baton Pass causes the user to switch out for another Pokémon, passing any stat changes to the Pokémon that switches in. These effects are passed:
Baton Pass.secondary_effect: Switches out the user but stat changes remain.

structuredEffects.effect: User switches out and passes all stat changes to incoming Pokémon

Beak Blast.effect: The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it's heating up its beak results in a burn.

structuredEffects.note: Applied to opponent making contact during charging phase

Beak Blast.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Beak Blast turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 180.
Beak Blast.detailed_effect: The user first heats up its beak, and then it attacks the target. Making direct contact with the Pokémon while it's heating up its beak results in a burn.
Beak Blast.secondary_effect: Moves first in turn to charge, and last in the same turn to Attack. If opponent makes physical contact between this, the opponent is Burned

Beat Up.effect: Each Pokémon in user's party attacks.
Beat Up.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Beat Up turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.
Beat Up.detailed_effect:
Beat Up deals damage from each Pokémon on your team that does not have a status ailment (nor is fainted). Each strike has a different base power , calculated as:

However, the actual attack is carried out by the original user of Beat Up , so it will always use that Pokémon's current attack stat to calculate damage. It will also receive any boosts from the originating user, such as STAB and any applicable items. However, any items held by the rest of the team do not affect the damage dealt.

Each strike of Beat Up is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.
Beat Up.secondary_effect: Does additional damage for every Pokémon in trainer's team.

Behemoth Bash.effect: Damage doubles if target is Dynamaxed.
Behemoth Bash.detailed_effect: Behemoth Bash deals damage, and if the target is Dynamaxed its power doubles to 200.
Behemoth Bash.secondary_effect: Increases damage by 100% if target is Dynamaxed

Behemoth Blade.effect: Damage doubles if target is Dynamaxed.
Behemoth Blade.detailed_effect: Behemoth Blade deals damage, and if the target is Dynamaxed its power doubles to 200.
Behemoth Blade.secondary_effect: Increases damage by 100% if target is Dynamaxed

Belch.effect: User must have consumed a Berry.
Belch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Belch turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 190.
Belch.detailed_effect: Belch deals damage, but only works if the user has previously consumed a Berry during the battle. Manually feeding a Berry from the bag does not count.

structuredEffects.condition: User has consumed a Berry during this battle
structuredEffects.effect: Move will only work if condition is met

Belly Drum.effect: User loses 50% of its max HP, but Attack raises to maximum.
Belly Drum.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Belly Drum turns into Z-Belly Drum and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Belly Drum.detailed_effect: User loses 50% of its max HP, but Attack raises to maximum.
Belly Drum.secondary_effect: Cut's half of user's maximum HP and maximizes Attack.

structuredEffects.note: Raises to maximum (+6 stages)

Bestow.effect: Gives the user's held item to the target.
Bestow.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bestow turns into Z-Bestow and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Bestow.detailed_effect:
Bestow gives the user's held item to the target.

It will not work if the target is already holding an item or is behind a Substitute . Mail cannot be transferred.

Items bestowed upon wild Pokémon are permanently lost if the Pokémon is KO'd, but items lost in Trainer battles are returned. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina ; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus ; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect ; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.

Bide.effect: User takes damage for two turns then strikes back double.
Bide.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bide turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Bide.detailed_effect:
The user of Bide stores energy for 2 turns. At the end of the second turn the Pokémon unleashes energy , dealing twice the HP damage it received.

Bide deals fixed, typeless damage, so will hit Ghost -type Pokémon. It also ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats and can hit Pokémon in the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

In double and triple battles, Bide hits the last Pokémon to attack the user (including teammates).

Bind.effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Bind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bind turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Bind.detailed_effect:
Bind inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.

If the user holds a Grip Claw , the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1/6 of the target's maximum HP.

Bite.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Bite turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.
Bite.detailed_effect:
Bite deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Bitter Blade.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on opponent.
Bitter Blade.detailed_effect: Bitter Blade deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the damage taken by the target.
Bitter Blade.secondary_effect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

Bitter Malice.detailed_effect:
Bitter Malice deals damage and lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Black Hole Eclipse.detailed_effect: Black Hole Eclipse is the Dark type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Blast Burn.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Blast Burn turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.

Blaze Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Blaze Kick turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.
Blaze Kick.detailed_effect:
Blaze Kick deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor , or those under the effects of Lucky Chant , are protected against critical hits.
Blaze Kick.secondary_effect: Has high critical hit ratio. May induce burn.

Only the Revavroom used by Team Star has this move.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

If used during rain , Bleakwind Storm ignores accuracy.
Bleakwind Storm.in_depth_effect: This move increases in accuracy to 100% during rain.
Bleakwind Storm.secondary_effect: Lowers all opponent's Speed one stage

Blizzard.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Blizzard turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 185.
Blizzard.detailed_effect:
Blizzard deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target. It will hit both opponents in a double battle or adjacent opponents in a triple battle.

Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

During a hailstorm , Blizzard ignores accuracy.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Bone Rush.detailed_effect:
Bone Rush hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Bone Rush is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Bone Rush to always hit the maximum number of times.
Bone Rush.secondary_effect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

Each strike of Bonemerang is treated like a separate attack:

Bounce.detailed_effect:

While in the air, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Gust , Twister , Thunder , Sky Uppercut and Smack Down , with Gust and Twister dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. If the user is holding a Power Herb , Bounce executes in one turn.
Bounce.secondary_effect: The user is protected the first turn, Attacks the second turn. May induce Paralysis

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

Burning Bulwark.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729

For example, if the Pokémon has the moves Psybeam , Discharge , Recover and Conversion in that order, Conversion will change the user's type to Psychic .

Conversion 2.effect: User changes type to become resistant to opponent's last move.

Conversion 2.detailed_effect:
Conversion 2 changes the user's type to one that is resistant (or immune) to the last move used by the target, randomly.

For example, if the target last used a Fighting type move, Conversion 2 would change the user's type to one of Poison , Flying , Psychic , Bug , Ghost or Fairy at random.
Conversion 2.secondary_effect: User becomes a type resistant to opponent's last Attack.

Cosmic Power.secondary_effect: Raises user's Defense and Special Defense one stage.

structuredEffects.note: Raises Defense by 3 stages (drastically)

Cotton Guard.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cotton Guard turns into Z-Cotton Guard and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Cotton Guard.detailed_effect:
Cotton Guard raises the user's Defense by three stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Assuming no other stat changes, the first use of Cotton Guard would raise Defense to 2. 5× normal value, and the second to 4× (the maximum level).

Cotton Spore.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cotton Spore turns into Z-Cotton Spore and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Cotton Spore.detailed_effect:
Cotton Spore lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Counter.effect: When hit by a Physical Attack, user strikes back with 2x power.

structuredEffects.note: Returns 2x damage from physical attacks

Counter.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Counter turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Counter.detailed_effect: When hit by a Physical Attack, user strikes back with 2x power.
Counter.secondary_effect: If hit by a physical Attack, deals double the damage received.

Court Change.effect: Swaps the effects on either side of the field.
Court Change.detailed_effect: Swaps the effects on either side of the field.
Court Change.secondary_effect: Swaps barriers, veils and other effects between each side of the battlefield

Covet.effect: Opponent's item is stolen by the user.
Covet.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Covet turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.
Covet.detailed_effect:
Covet deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not already holding an item.

Items stolen from wild Pokémon are kept after the battle ends, but items stolen from a Trainer's Pokémon are not. Items stolen from the player's Pokémon, either by wild Pokémon or Trainer Pokémon, are returned at the end of the battle. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.

If the item would activate on attack (e. g. Focus Band ), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e. g. Focus Sash ) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina ; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus ; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect ; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
Covet.secondary_effect: May steal opponent's item (temporarily in trainer battles).

Crabhammer.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crabhammer turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 180.
Crabhammer.detailed_effect: Crabhammer deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Crabhammer.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Crafty Shield.effect: Protects the Pokémon from status moves.
Crafty Shield.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Crafty Shield.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crafty Shield turns into Z-Crafty Shield and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Crafty Shield.detailed_effect:
Crafty Shield protects the user's team from any Status category move targeted at them, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves.

It does not protect against the moves Perish Song , Spikes , Stealth Rock , Toxic Spikes , or Sticky Web ; and it does not prevent moves that target the attacker itself (such as Rest ).

Cross Chop.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cross Chop turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.
Cross Chop.detailed_effect: Cross Chop deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Cross Chop.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Cross Poison.effect: High critical hit ratio. May poison opponent.
Cross Poison.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cross Poison turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 140.
Cross Poison.detailed_effect:
Cross Poison deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Cross Poison.secondary_effect: Has high critical hit ratio. May induce poison.

Crunch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crunch turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
Crunch.detailed_effect:
Crunch deals damage and has a 20% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Crunch.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

Crush Claw.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crush Claw turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Crush Claw.detailed_effect:
Crush Claw deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Crush Claw.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

Crush Grip.effect: More powerful when opponent has higher HP.
Crush Grip.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Crush Grip turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.
Crush Grip.detailed_effect:
Crush Grip inflicts more damage when the opponent's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 120 and it decreases in proportion - i. e. the power is:

Crush Grip is a Physical-category counterpart move to Wring Out . It is also similar to Water Spout and Eruption , based on the opponent rather than the user.
Crush Grip.in_depth_effect: This attack's Base Power is anything from 1 up to 120. The means of determining the Base Power is set based on the Opponent's Hit Points. This does not refer to the Base Stats for the Hit Points but rather the opponent's HP relative to its maximum at the current point in time. With this in mind, a simple equation is made to determine the base power of the attack: Base Power = 120 * (Opponent's Current HP / Opponent's Max HP)
Crush Grip.secondary_effect: Increases damage the higher the target's Hit Points

Curse.effect: Ghosts lose 50% of max HP and curse the opponent; Non-Ghosts raise Attack, Defense and lower Speed.
Curse.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Curse turns into Z-Curse and either fully restores the user's HP if it is Ghost type, or raises Attack one stage otherwise, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Curse.detailed_effect:
Curse is a unique move that works differently for Ghost -type Pokémon than other Pokémon.

Ghost-type Pokémon use 50% of their maximum HP to place a curse on the target. The cursed Pokémon loses 25% of their maximum HP every turn. If the user has less than 50% HP remaining, they will faint but the curse still takes effect.

For all other Pokémon, Curse raises the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each and lowers Speed by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Curse.secondary_effect: Ghost type Pokémon: User loses half their maximum HP, and the opponent gets a Nightmare. Other Pokémon types: Raises user's Attack and Defense one stage. Lowers user's Speed one stage.

Cut.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Cut turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Cut.detailed_effect: Cut deals damage with no additional effect in battle.

Dark Pulse.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Dark Pulse.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dark Pulse turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
Dark Pulse.detailed_effect:
Dark Pulse deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Dark Void.effect: Puts all adjacent opponents to sleep.
Dark Void.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dark Void turns into Z-Dark Void and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Dark Void.detailed_effect:
Dark Void puts the target(s) to sleep. It can only be used by Darkrai .

It targets all adjacent opponents i. e. the opposing Pokémon in a single battle, both opponents in a double battle, three opponents if in the center of a triple battle, or two opponents if situated at the side in a triple battle. Each target is counted as a separate attack so it may succeed for all, any or none of the targets.

Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

Darkest Lariat.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Darkest Lariat turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
Darkest Lariat.detailed_effect: Darkest Lariat deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i. e. Defense and Evasion in this case).

Dazzling Gleam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dazzling Gleam turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 160.
Dazzling Gleam.detailed_effect: Dazzling Gleam deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles.

Decorate.effect: Sharply raises target's Attack and Special Attack.
Decorate.detailed_effect: Sharply raises target's Attack and Special Attack. (100% chance)
Decorate.secondary_effect: Raises target's Attack and Special Attack by 2 stages

Defend Order.effect: Raises user's Defense and Special Defense.
Defend Order.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defend Order turns into Z-Defend Order and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Defend Order.detailed_effect:
Defend Order raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Defend Order.secondary_effect: Raises user's Defense and Special Defense one stage.

structuredEffects.note: Also enables Rollout and Ice Ball to deal 2x damage while active

Defense Curl.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defense Curl turns into Z-Defense Curl and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Defense Curl.detailed_effect:
Defense Curl raises the user's Defense by one stage. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

After Defense Curl has been used at least once and while the user stays in battle, the power of Rollout and Ice Ball is double their regular base power.
Defense Curl.secondary_effect: Raises user's Defense one stage. Damage from Rollout & Ice Ball is doubled.

Defog.effect: Lowers opponent's Evasiveness and clears fog.
Defog.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Defog turns into Z-Defog and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Defog.detailed_effect:
Defog lowers the target's Evasion by one stage and removes entry hazards and barriers on both sides of the field. The moves affected are: Light Screen , Reflect , Mist , Safeguard , Spikes , Stealth Rock , Sticky Web and Toxic Spikes .

Defog also clears foggy weather in battle (which causes Accuracy loss when present), however this weather condition is only present in Sinnoh (Diamond/Pearl/Platinum) and cannot be created in battle otherwise.
Defog.in_depth_effect: This attack also removes the effect of Reflect, Light Screen, Aurora Veil, Safeguard, Mist, Spikes, Toxic Spikes and Stealth Rock on the target Pokémon's side of battle. It also removes the effects of all Terrains on the battlefield if it has been set up by a Pokémon using moves or abilities.

Destiny Bond.effect: If the user faints, the opponent also faints.

structuredEffects.note: Fails if used consecutively

Destiny Bond.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Destiny Bond turns into Z-Destiny Bond and makes the Pokémon become the center of attention, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Destiny Bond.detailed_effect: If the user faints, the opponent also faints.
Destiny Bond.secondary_effect: If the user faints, the opponent will also faint. Will fail on successive uses.

Detect.effect: Protects the user, but may fail if used consecutively.

structuredEffects.note: Accuracy: 1st use 100%, 2nd use 33%, 3rd use 11%, 4th use 4%, and so on

Detect.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Detect turns into Z-Detect and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Detect.detailed_effect:
Detect prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move functions identically to Protect .

The accuracy of Detect drops by 1/3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect , Endure , Wide Guard , Quick Guard , Spiky Shield , King's Shield , or Baneful Bunker .

Damage-dealing Z-Moves bypass Detect but deal 1/4 of the damage.
Detect.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Detect.secondary_effect: Prevents being hit by the opponent's Attack. May fail on successive uses

Devastating Drake.detailed_effect: Devastating Drake is the Dragon type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Diamond Storm.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Diamond Storm turns into Continental Crush and has base power 180.
Diamond Storm.detailed_effect:
Diamond Storm deals damage and has a 50% chance of raising the user's Defense by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Dig.effect: Digs underground on first turn, attacks on second. Can also escape from caves.
Dig.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dig turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 160.
Dig.detailed_effect:
The user of Dig will burrow its way underground on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Dig deals damage.

While underground, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Earthquake , Magnitude or Fissure , with Earthquake and Magnitude dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. The user also avoids end-of-turn damage from Sandstorm and Hail when underground.

If the user is holding a Power Herb , Dig executes in one turn.
Dig.secondary_effect: The user is protected the first turn, Attacks the second turn.

Dire Claw.effect: May poison, paralyze or put the opponent to sleep.

structuredEffects.note: 33% chance if this branch is selected (shared with paralysis and sleep)
33% chance if this branch is selected (shared with poison and sleep)
33% chance if this branch is selected (shared with poison and paralysis)

Dire Claw.detailed_effect:
Dire Claw deals damage and has a 50% chance of either poisoning, paralyzing, or putting the target to sleep.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Dire Claw.secondary_effect: Has a chance of inflicting Poison, Paralysis or Sleep.

Disable.effect: Opponent can't use its last attack for a few turns.
Disable.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Disable turns into Z-Disable and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Disable.detailed_effect: Disable causes the previous move the target used to be disabled for 1-8 turns, which prevents the move's use.

Disarming Voice.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Disarming Voice turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.
Disarming Voice.detailed_effect: Disarming Voice deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Discharge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Discharge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.
Discharge.detailed_effect:
Discharge deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target(s).

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Dive.effect: Dives underwater on first turn, attacks on second turn.
Dive.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dive turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
Dive.detailed_effect:
The user of Dive will hide underwater on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Dive deals damage.

While underwater, the Pokémon can only be hit by the moves Surf , Whirlpool or Low Kick , with Surf and Whirlpool dealing twice normal damage. Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit for regular power. The user also avoids end-of-turn damage from Sandstorm and Hail when underwater.

If the user is holding a Power Herb , Dive executes in one turn.
Dive.secondary_effect: The user is protected the first turn, Attacks the second turn.

Dizzy Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dizzy Punch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Dizzy Punch.detailed_effect:
Dizzy Punch deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

Doodle.effect: Changes the abilities of the user and its teammates to that of the target.
Doodle.detailed_effect: Changes the abilities of the user and its teammates to that of the target.
Doodle.secondary_effect: Changes the Abilities of all your Pokémon on the field to that of the targetted Pokémon

structuredEffects.note: Damage is calculated based on opponent at time of impact, not selection

Doom Desire.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Doom Desire turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 200.
Doom Desire.detailed_effect: Two turns after the move is selected, Doom Desire will deal damage. If the opponent switched Pokémon in the meantime, the damage dealt will depend on the Special Defense of the Pokémon the move hits, not the Pokémon it was originally targeted at.

Double Hit.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Hit turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Double Hit.detailed_effect:
Double Hit deals damage and will strike twice (with 35 base power each time).

Each strike of Double Hit is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

Double Iron Bash.effect: Hits twice in one turn; may cause flinching.
Double Iron Bash.detailed_effect: Double Iron Bash deals damage, will strike twice (with 60 base power each time), and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Double Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Double Kick.detailed_effect:
Double Kick deals damage and will strike twice (with 30 base power each time).

Each strike of Double Kick is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

Double Shock.effect: After using this move, the user will no longer be Electric type.

structuredEffects.note: If user was pure Electric-type, it becomes typeless

Double Shock.detailed_effect: After using this move, the user will no longer be Electric type.
Double Shock.secondary_effect: Removes Electric-type from user. If user was pure Electric-type, it is now without a type.

structuredEffects.note: Skill Link ability causes it to always hit 5 times

Double Slap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Slap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Double Slap.detailed_effect:
Double Slap hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Double Slap is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Double Slap to always hit the maximum number of times.

Double Team.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double Team turns into Z-Double Team and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Double Team.detailed_effect:
Double Team raises the user's Evasiveness by one stage, thus making the user more difficult to hit.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Double-Edge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Double-Edge turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.
Double-Edge.detailed_effect: Double-Edge deals damage, but the user receives 1/3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
Double-Edge.secondary_effect: User takes recoil damage equal to a third of the damage inflicted.

Draco Meteor.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Draco Meteor turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 195.
Draco Meteor.detailed_effect:
Draco Meteor deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Draco Meteor.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Special Attack two stages.

Dragon Ascent.effect: Lowers user's Defense and Special Defense.
Dragon Ascent.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Ascent turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 190.
Dragon Ascent.detailed_effect:
Dragon Ascent deals damage but lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each after attacking.

It is the signature move of Rayquaza , and once learned allows Rayquaza to Mega-Evolve.
Dragon Ascent.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Defense & Special Defense stats by one stage.

Dragon Breath.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Breath turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 120.
Dragon Breath.detailed_effect:
Dragon Breath deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

structuredEffects.note: Increases by 2 stages if target is Dragon-type. Cannot be used on same Pokemon multiple times

Dragon Cheer.detailed_effect: The user raises its allies’ morale with a draconic cry so that their future attacks have a heightened chance of landing critical hits. This rouses Dragon types more.
Dragon Cheer.secondary_effect: Raises Critical Hit Rate by 1 stageRaises Critical Hit Rate by 2 stages for Dragon-typesThis cannot be used on the same Pokémon multiple times

Dragon Claw.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Claw turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 160.
Dragon Claw.detailed_effect: Dragon Claw deals damage with no additional effect.

Dragon Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Dance turns into Z-Dragon Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Dragon Dance.detailed_effect:
Dragon Dance raises the user's Attack and Speed by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Dragon Dance.secondary_effect: Raises user's Attack and Speed one stage.

structuredEffects.note: In doubles, hits each opponent once. If one opponent protects/is Fairy-type, both hits target the other

Dragon Darts.detailed_effect:
Dragon Darts deals damage and hits twice. In a double battle, it hits each opponent once.

Dragon Darts is the signature move of Dragapult .
Dragon Darts.secondary_effect: In Doubles, if one of the two opponents protects or is a Fairy-type Pokémon, it hits the opponent that doesn't protect twice.

Dragon Energy.effect: The higher the user's HP, the higher the power.
Dragon Energy.detailed_effect: The higher the user's HP, the higher the power.
Dragon Energy.in_depth_effect: This attack has a Base Power of 150 but it is dependent on the User's HP. This is calculated by the formula: Base Power = (User's Current HP * 150) / (User's Max HP). This gives it a maximum power of 150 and a Minimum of 1.
Dragon Energy.secondary_effect: Inflicts more damage when the user's HP is high.

Dragon Hammer.effect: The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage.
Dragon Hammer.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Hammer turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 175.
Dragon Hammer.detailed_effect: The user uses its body like a hammer to attack the target and inflict damage.

Dragon Pulse.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Dragon Pulse.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Pulse turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 160.
Dragon Pulse.detailed_effect: Dragon Pulse deals damage with no additional effect.

Dragon Rage.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Rage turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100.
Dragon Rage.detailed_effect: Dragon Rage always deals 40 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing. It has no additional effect.

Dragon Rush.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Rush turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 180.
Dragon Rush.detailed_effect:
Dragon Rush deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

If the target has used Minimize , Dragon Rush ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

Dragon Tail.effect: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.

structuredEffects.note: In wild battles, causes opponent to flee

Dragon Tail.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dragon Tail turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 120.
Dragon Tail.detailed_effect: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.

Drain Punch.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on opponent.
Drain Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drain Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.
Drain Punch.detailed_effect:
Drain Punch deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root, the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze , the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Drain Punch.secondary_effect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

Draining Kiss.effect: User recovers most the HP inflicted on opponent.
Draining Kiss.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Draining Kiss turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.
Draining Kiss.detailed_effect: Draining Kiss deals damage and the user will recover 75% of the HP drained.

Dream Eater.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on a sleeping opponent.

structuredEffects.note: Fails if target is not asleep. Big Root increases to 65%

Dream Eater.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dream Eater turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 180.
Dream Eater.detailed_effect:
Dream Eater deals damage only on sleeping foes and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root , the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze , the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Dream Eater.secondary_effect: User recovers half the damage inflicted on a sleeping opponent.

Drill Peck.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Drill Peck.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drill Peck turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160.
Drill Peck.detailed_effect: Drill Peck deals damage with no additional effect, besides being able to hit non-adjacent Pokémon in triple battles.

Drill Run.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Drill Run turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 160.
Drill Run.detailed_effect: Drill Run deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Drill Run.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Dual Chop.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dual Chop turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100.
Dual Chop.detailed_effect:
Dual Chop deals damage and will strike twice (with 40 base power each time).

Each strike of Dual Chop is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

Dual Wingbeat.effect: The user slams the target with its wings. The target is hit twice in a row.
Dual Wingbeat.detailed_effect:
The user slams the target with its wings. The target is hit twice in a row.

Dual Wingbeat is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Dynamax Cannon.effect: Damage doubles if opponent is Dynamaxed.
Dynamax Cannon.detailed_effect: Damage doubles if opponent is Dynamaxed.
Dynamax Cannon.secondary_effect: Increases damage by 100% if target is Dynamaxed

Dynamic Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Dynamic Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.
Dynamic Punch.detailed_effect:
Dynamic Punch deals damage and confuses the target, if it hits. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

Earth Power.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Earth Power turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175.
Earth Power.detailed_effect:
Earth Power deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Earth Power.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

Earthquake.effect: Power is doubled if opponent is underground from using Dig.
Earthquake.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Earthquake turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180.
Earthquake.detailed_effect: Earthquake deals damage, and will hit with double power if the opponent is underground due to the move Dig .
Earthquake.in_depth_effect: If used against an opponent that is using Dig, the damage inflicted will be doubled

structuredEffects.note: Power increases each turn if any Pokemon on field uses it. Does not reset on miss

Echoed Voice.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Echoed Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Echoed Voice.detailed_effect:
Echoed Voice deals damage starting at base power 40, and increases by 40 each turn if used by any Pokémon on the field, up to a maximum base power of 200.

It does not reset if it misses, as long as the move is attempted each turn. The power does not increase during a turn (if multiple Pokémon use it), only after each turn.
Echoed Voice.in_depth_effect: This move increases in power when used by Pokémon on your side in the last turn. The increase is by 100%. If two Pokémon use it in Double or Triple Battles or it's used repeatedly, the second power is 80 and if a third Pokémon uses it, its Base Power is 160. If it's used a fourth time within the same two turns, it is capped at 200.

Eerie Impulse.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eerie Impulse turns into Z-Eerie Impulse and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Eerie Impulse.detailed_effect:
Eerie Impulse lowers the target's Special Attack by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Eerie Impulse.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Special Attack two stages.

Eerie Spell.effect: Deals damage and reduces opponent's PP.
Eerie Spell.detailed_effect: Eerie Spell deals damage and reduces the PP of the target's last-used move by 3.
Eerie Spell.secondary_effect: Opponents last move is reduced by 3 PP

Egg Bomb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Egg Bomb turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.
Egg Bomb.detailed_effect: Egg Bomb deals damage with no additional effect.

Electric Terrain.effect: Prevents all Pokémon from falling asleep for 5 turns.
Electric Terrain.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electric Terrain turns into Z-Electric Terrain and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Electric Terrain.detailed_effect:
Electric Terrain creates a low-lying electric field lasting 5 turns, that prevents grounded Pokémon from falling asleep. The power of Electric type moves also increases by 50% while in effect.

Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised . Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Electric Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.

The move Nature Power turns into Thunderbolt under Electric Terrain .
Electric Terrain.in_depth_effect: This move creates a terrain that helps Pokémon on the ground for 5 turns. It prevents the Pokémon from sleep and boosts the power of Electric-type moves on grounded Pokémon by 30%

Electrify.effect: Changes the target's move to Electric type.

structuredEffects.note: Only works if target hasn't moved yet

Electrify.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electrify turns into Z-Electrify and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Electrify.detailed_effect: Electrify causes the target's move to become Electric type, if it has yet to attack during that turn.
Electrify.secondary_effect: Causes target's moves to become Electric-type for this turn

Electro Ball.effect: The faster the user, the stronger the attack.
Electro Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electro Ball turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.
Electro Ball.detailed_effect:
Electro Ball inflicts more damage the faster the user is compared to the opponent. The table shows the different base powers for each ratio, where r = User Speed ÷ Target Speed

For example, if the user's Speed is at least 3 times more than the target but less than 4 times, Electro Ball hits with 120 base power.
Electro Ball.in_depth_effect: Electro Ball is unique in that its power is determined based upon both the user's speed and the speed of the target. More damage is inflicted if the opponent is slower than the user. This isn't done via a specific calculation but has set amounts based upon the speed values of the User & Target. If the Target Speed > 50% of User Speed, the move is 60 BP, Target Speed > 33% of User Speed, the move is 80 BP, Target Speed > 25% of User Speed, the move is 120 BP, and if Target Speed < 25% of User Speed, the move is 150 BP.
Electro Ball.secondary_effect: Increases damage based on the Speed of the user and opponent

Electro Drift.effect: Boosted even more if it's super-effective.
Electro Drift.detailed_effect: Boosted even more if it's super-effective.
Electro Drift.secondary_effect: Boosts damage by 33% if the move is Super Effective on the target

Electro Shot.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second.

structuredEffects.note: Instant in rain. Raises Special Attack during charge turn

Electro Shot.detailed_effect:
The user absorbs electricity on the first turn and raises its Special Attack; on the second turn, Electro Shot deals damage.

During rain , Electro Shot executes in one turn.
Electro Shot.secondary_effect: Raises user's Special Attack one stage

Electroweb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Electroweb turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.
Electroweb.detailed_effect:
Electroweb deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Embargo.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Embargo turns into Z-Embargo and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Embargo.detailed_effect: Embargo prevents the target using any items for five turns. This includes both held items and items used by the trainer such as medicines.

Ember.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ember turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 100.
Ember.detailed_effect:
Ember deals damage and has a 10% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Encore.effect: Forces opponent to keep using its last move for 3 turns.

structuredEffects.note: Fails against Encore, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Struggle, Transform

Encore.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Encore turns into Z-Encore and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Encore.detailed_effect:
Encore forces the target to use the previously selected move for 3 turns.

Encore does not work against Encore itself, Mimic , Mirror Move , Sketch , Struggle or Transform .
Encore.in_depth_effect: This move causes the target to use their last used move for their next three turns. It will fail if the target's move failed, it hasn't used a move since being sent out, or if the last move they used has 0PP. It will also fail if the target used Encore, Mimic, Mirror Move, Sketch, Struggle or Transform in their last turn.
Encore.secondary_effect: Opponent repeats the last move for 3 turns.

Endeavor.effect: Reduces opponent's HP to same as user's.

structuredEffects.note: Fails if user's HP is higher than target's

Endeavor.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Endeavor turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Endeavor.detailed_effect: Endeavor reduces the opponent's HP to equal the user's. (It fails if the user's HP is higher than the target's.)
Endeavor.secondary_effect: Reduces the target's Hit Points to match the current Hit Points of the user.

Endure.effect: Always left with at least 1 HP, but may fail if used consecutively.

structuredEffects.note: Success rate decreases with consecutive use after protection moves: 1st=100%, 2nd=33%, 3rd=11%, 4th=4%, etc.

Endure.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Endure turns into Z-Endure and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Endure.detailed_effect:
Endure allows the user to survive all attacks during the turn with at least 1 HP (even if it already has 1 HP remaining). It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves.

The accuracy of Endure decreases by 1/3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect , Detect , Wide Guard , Quick Guard , Spiky Shield , King's Shield , or Baneful Bunker .
Endure.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729. This move doesn't prevent damage from attacks, but rather it prevents the Pokémon from fainting. When Endure is used and is successful, it will prevent the user from being knocked out by leaving the user with 1 Hit Point. This lasts the entire turn so it can receive multiple hits which end up doing no damage.
Endure.secondary_effect: Survives any Attack for one turn leaving at least 1 HP but may fail with successive uses.

Energy Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Energy Ball turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175.
Energy Ball.detailed_effect:
Energy Ball deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Energy Ball.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

Entrainment.effect: Makes target's ability same as user's.

structuredEffects.note: Does not work on Truant, Multitype, or Zen Mode abilities

Entrainment.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Entrainment turns into Z-Entrainment and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Entrainment.detailed_effect:
Entrainment makes the target's ability the same as the user's.

It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant , Multitype or Zen Mode .
Entrainment.in_depth_effect: This move changes the opponent's abiliy to that of the user of this move. Doesn't work against Pokémon with the Truant, Zen Mode or Multitype abilities.
Entrainment.secondary_effect: Causes target's ability to match the user

Eruption.effect: Stronger when the user's HP is higher.
Eruption.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Eruption turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.
Eruption.detailed_effect:
Eruption inflicts more damage when the user's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 150 and it decreases in proportion - i. e. the power is:

Eruption is a counterpart move to Water Spout . It is also similar to Crush Grip and Wring Out , based on the user rather than the opponent.
Eruption.in_depth_effect: This attack has a Base Power of 150 but is dependent on the User's HP. This is calculated with the following formula: Base Power = (User's Current HP * 150) / (User's Max HP). This gives it a maximum power of 150 and a Minimum of 1.
Eruption.secondary_effect: Inflicts more damage when the user's HP is high.

Esper Wing.effect: High critical hit ratio. Raises user's Speed.
Esper Wing.detailed_effect:
Esper Wing deals damage and raises the user's Speed by one stage. It also has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Eternabeam.effect: User can't move on the next turn.
Eternabeam.detailed_effect: User can't move on the next turn.

Expanding Force.effect: Increases power and hits all opponents on Psychic Terrain.
Expanding Force.detailed_effect:
The user attacks the target with its psychic power. This move’s power goes up and damages all opposing Pokémon on Psychic Terrain.

Expanding Force is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Explosion.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Explosion turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.
Explosion.detailed_effect: Explosion deals high damage, but causes the user to faint.

Extrasensory.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Extrasensory turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.
Extrasensory.detailed_effect:
Extrasensory deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).
