Hurricane.in_depth_effect: This move increases in accuracy to 100% during rain but drops to 50% accuracy within harsh sunlight.
Hurricane.secondary_effect: May induce CONFUSION. Damages Pokémon using Fly, Bounce or Sky Drop

Hydro Cannon.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hydro Cannon turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 200.
Hydro Cannon.secondary_effect: User cannot Attack on the next turn.

Hydro Pump.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hydro Pump turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.
Hydro Pump.detailed_effect: Hydro Pump deals damage with no additional effect.

Hydro Steam.detailed_effect: Hydro Steam deals damage, and its power is boosted by 50% in harsh sunlight, instead of being reduced.

Hydro Vortex.detailed_effect: Hydro Vortex is the Water type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Hyper Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Beam turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.
Hyper Beam.detailed_effect:
Hyper Beam deals damage, but the user must recharge on the next turn (bringing its effective power down to 75 per turn).

If the user has the ability Truant , it will recharge in the same turn that it loafs around .

Hyper Beam is the Special counterpart to Giga Impact .
Hyper Beam.secondary_effect: User cannot Attack on the next turn.

Hyper Fang.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Fang turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Hyper Fang.detailed_effect:
Hyper Fang deals damage and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Hyper Voice.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyper Voice turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
Hyper Voice.detailed_effect: Hyper Voice deals damage with no additional effect, besides targeting multiple foes. Hyper Voice has no effect on Pokémon with the ability Soundproof .

Hyperspace Fury.effect: Lowers user's Defense. Can strike through Protect/Detect.
Hyperspace Fury.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Fury turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 180.
Hyperspace Fury.detailed_effect:
Hyperspace Fury deals damage but lowers the user's Defense by one stage after attacking. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect -like move.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Hyperspace Fury is the signature move of Hoopa Unbound .

Hyperspace Hole.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hyperspace Hole turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.
Hyperspace Hole.detailed_effect:
Hyperspace Hole deals damage and always hits, even if the target used a Protect -like move.

It is the signature move of Hoopa .

Hypnosis.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Hypnosis turns into Z-Hypnosis and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Hypnosis.detailed_effect:
Hypnosis puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

Ice Ball.effect: Doubles in power each turn for 5 turns.
Ice Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Ball turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.
Ice Ball.detailed_effect:
Ice Ball deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Ice Ball will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively.

If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Ice Ball doubles in power, i. e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively.

As Ice Ball has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Ice Ball is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns.

Ice Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Beam turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 175.
Ice Beam.detailed_effect:
Ice Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target.

Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

Ice Burn.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second. May burn opponent.
Ice Burn.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Burn turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 200.
Ice Burn.detailed_effect:
The user of Ice Burn will charge on the first turn. On the second turn, it deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. If the user is holding a Power Herb , Ice Burn executes in one turn.

Ice Fang.effect: May cause flinching and/or freeze opponent.
Ice Fang.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Fang turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 120.
Ice Fang.detailed_effect:
Ice Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of freezing the target and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Ice Fang.secondary_effect: May FREEZE opponent or cause opponent to flinch.

Ice Hammer.effect: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user's Speed, however.
Ice Hammer.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Hammer turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 180.
Ice Hammer.detailed_effect: The user swings and hits with its strong, heavy fist. It lowers the user's Speed, however. (100% chance)

Ice Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Punch turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.
Ice Punch.detailed_effect:
Ice Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target.

Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

Ice Shard.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ice Shard turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.
Ice Shard.detailed_effect:
Ice Shard deals damage and has a priority of +1.

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

Icicle Crash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icicle Crash turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 160.
Icicle Crash.detailed_effect:
Icicle Crash deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Icicle Spear.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icicle Spear turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 140.
Icicle Spear.detailed_effect:
Icicle Spear hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Icicle Spear is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Icicle Spear to always hit the maximum number of times.
Icicle Spear.secondary_effect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

Icy Wind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Icy Wind turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.
Icy Wind.detailed_effect:
Icy Wind deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Icy Wind.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Speed one stage.

Imprison.effect: Opponent is unable to use moves that the user also knows.
Imprison.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Imprison turns into Z-Imprison and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Imprison.detailed_effect: Opponent is unable to use moves that the user also knows.
Imprison.secondary_effect: Opponent cannot use any move that user knows.

Incinerate.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Incinerate turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 120.
Incinerate.detailed_effect:
Incinerate deals damage and if the target is holding a Berry, it is burnt and becomes no longer usable.

If Incinerate would be super-effective and the target is holding an Occa Berry , the Berry activates before the move hits so does not get burnt.

Infernal Parade.effect: Inflicts double damage if the target has a status condition.
Infernal Parade.detailed_effect:
Infernal Parade deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target. If the target already has a status condition, its power is doubled.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.
Infernal Parade.secondary_effect: Doubles damage when targed is afflicted with a status condition

Inferno.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Inferno turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.
Inferno.detailed_effect:
Inferno deals damage and burns the target, if it hits. Burned Pokémon lose 1/8 of their maximum HP each turn and their Attack is decreased by 50%.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Inferno Overdrive.detailed_effect: Inferno Overdrive is the Fire type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Infestation.effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Infestation.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Infestation turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.
Infestation.detailed_effect:
Infestation inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.

If the user holds a Grip Claw , the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1/6 of the target's maximum HP.

Ingrain.effect: User restores HP each turn. User cannot escape/switch.
Ingrain.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ingrain turns into Z-Ingrain and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Ingrain.detailed_effect:
The user of Ingrain plants it roots, which restores 1/16 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn, but prevents switching out.

Only the moves Baton Pass , U Turn or Volt Switch will allow the user to switch out, with Baton Pass transferring the effects of Ingrain . Moves such as Roar used on this Pokémon will have no effect.

Ingrain cancels effects given to raised Pokémon such as immunity to Ground -type moves, Spikes and so on.

If the user is holding a Big Root , Ingrain restores 30% more HP each turn - approximately 1/12 of its maximum.
Ingrain.secondary_effect: Recovers user's Hit Points by 1/16th each turn. Prevents user from Switching out.

Instruct.effect: Allows an ally to use a move instead.
Instruct.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Instruct turns into Z-Instruct and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Instruct.detailed_effect: Instruct tells the user's teammate in a double/triple battle to use its most recent move instead of them. In other words, it allows a teammate to attack twice instead of the two Pokémon attacking once each.
Instruct.secondary_effect: Causes target to use their last move again

Ion Deluge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ion Deluge turns into Z-Ion Deluge and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Ion Deluge.detailed_effect: Ion Deluge changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type for all Pokémon on the field, for the remainder of the turn.

Iron Defense.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Defense turns into Z-Iron Defense and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Iron Defense.detailed_effect:
Iron Defense raises the user's Defense by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Iron Head.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Head turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 160.
Iron Head.detailed_effect:
Iron Head deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Iron Tail.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Iron Tail turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180.
Iron Tail.detailed_effect:
Iron Tail deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Iron Tail.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

Ivy Cudgel.effect: High critical hit ratio. Type changes based on form.
Ivy Cudgel.detailed_effect: Ivy Cudgel deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ). Its type changes based on the mask worn by Ogerpon :
Ivy Cudgel.secondary_effect: Changes to Grass type as standard.Water-type if holding the Wellspring MaskFire-type if holding the Hearthflame MaskRock-type if holding the Cornerstone Mask

Jaw Lock.effect: Prevents user and opponent from switching out.
Jaw Lock.detailed_effect: Prevents user and opponent from switching out.
Jaw Lock.secondary_effect: Prevents both the user and the target from escaping

Judgment.effect: Type depends on the Arceus Plate being held.
Judgment.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Judgment turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 180.
Judgment.detailed_effect: Type depends on the Arceus Plate being held.
Judgment.secondary_effect: Changes the type of the move based upon the item being held

Jump Kick.effect: If it misses, the user loses half their HP.
Jump Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Jump Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 180.
Jump Kick.detailed_effect: Jump Kick deals damage, however, if it misses the user keeps going and crashes, losing 1/2 of its maximum HP. Jump Kick cannot be used if Gravity is in effect.

Jungle Healing.effect: Restores team's HP and cures status conditions.
Jungle Healing.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Jungle Healing.detailed_effect: Restores team's HP and cures status conditions.
Jungle Healing.secondary_effect: Heals the Hit Points of the user and ally by 25% of maximum HP. Removes status conditions from the user and ally

Karate Chop.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Karate Chop turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Karate Chop.detailed_effect: Karate Chop deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Kinesis.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Kinesis turns into Z-Kinesis and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Kinesis.detailed_effect:
Kinesis lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

King's Shield.effect: Protects the user and lowers opponent's Attack on contact.
King's Shield.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, King's Shield turns into Z-King's Shield and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
King's Shield.detailed_effect:
King's Shield prevents any Physical or Special attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the King's Shield user, the opponent's Attack is lowered by two stages. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

The accuracy of King's Shield drops by 1/3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect , Detect , Endure , Wide Guard , Quick Guard , Spiky Shield , or Baneful Bunker .
King's Shield.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
King's Shield.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Attack one stage if hit by physical contact

Knock Off.effect: Removes opponent's held item for the rest of the battle.
Knock Off.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Knock Off turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.
Knock Off.detailed_effect:
Knock Off deals damage and if the target has a held item, damage is increased by 50% (i. e. 97. 5 base power) and the item is removed for the remainder of the battle (switching out does not restore the item). All items are restored at the end of a battle.

If the item would activate on attack (e. g. Focus Band ), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e. g. Focus Sash ) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina ; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus ; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect ; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon. Note that in these cases the damage dealt does not increase.
Knock Off.in_depth_effect: If the target of this move is holding an item, then the target will lose the item and the power of the move is increased by 50%. The item cannot be recovered with RecycleIf the Pokémon is holding an item that cannot be removed, such as Giratina with the Griseous Orb, Arceus holding any of its plates or a Pokémon who is holding a Mega Stone needed for it to Mega Evolve, then the move will not do extra damage and they will not lose the hold item. If the user is knocked out from recoil caused by the opponent's hold item or ability, then the opponent will keep the hold item. If the target has got the Sticky Hold ability, the damage will be increased, but the opponent will not lose the hold item.
Knock Off.secondary_effect: Knocks down opponent's held item to prevent its use. Increases power by 50% if so.

Land's Wrath.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Land's Wrath turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 185.
Land's Wrath.detailed_effect: Land's Wrath deals damage with no additional effects.

Laser Focus.effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to result in a critical hit.
Laser Focus.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Laser Focus turns into Z-Laser Focus and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Laser Focus.detailed_effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to result in a critical hit.

Lash Out.effect: Double power if stats were lowered during the turn.
Lash Out.detailed_effect:
The user lashes out to vent its frustration toward the target. If its stats were lowered during the turn, the power of this move is doubled.

Lash Out is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.
Lash Out.secondary_effect: Doubles power if the user's stats had been lowered during the turn

Last Resort.effect: Can only be used after all other moves are used.
Last Resort.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Last Resort turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.
Last Resort.detailed_effect: Last Resort deals high damage, but will fail if the user has not used each of its other moves at least once (or has no other moves). If the user switches out, the move gets reset and when it switches back in, will need to use each of its other moves at least once in order to use Last Resort again.

Last Respects.effect: Damages increases the more party Pokémon have been defeated.
Last Respects.detailed_effect: Damages increases the more party Pokémon have been defeated.
Last Respects.in_depth_effect: This attack will increase its base power based on the amount of Pokémon that are fainted in your party. For each Pokémon fainted, it increases by 50 base power.

Lava Plume.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lava Plume turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 160.
Lava Plume.detailed_effect:
Lava Plume deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Leaf Blade.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Blade turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175.
Leaf Blade.detailed_effect: Leaf Blade deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Leaf Blade.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Leaf Storm.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Storm turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 195.
Leaf Storm.detailed_effect:
Leaf Storm deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Leaf Storm.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Special Attack two stages.

Leaf Tornado.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leaf Tornado turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 120.
Leaf Tornado.detailed_effect:
Leaf Tornado deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

Leafage.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leafage turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.

Leech Life.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on opponent.
Leech Life.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leech Life turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160.
Leech Life.detailed_effect:
Leech Life deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root , the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze , the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Leech Life.secondary_effect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

Leech Seed.effect: Drains HP from opponent each turn.

structuredEffects.note: Leech Seed drains 1/8 (12.5%) of target's max HP each turn, not per hit. Applies Big Root and Liquid Ooze interactions.

Leech Seed.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leech Seed turns into Z-Leech Seed and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Leech Seed.detailed_effect:
Leech Seed plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn and restores it to the user, or any Pokémon that takes its place. It does not work on Grass -type Pokémon; it does technically work against Pokémon with the Magic Guard ability, but no HP will be sapped.

If the user is holding a Big Root , the move still saps the same amount of HP but recovers 30% more than normal. For example, if a Pokémon has 320 HP, Leech Seed would cause them to lose 40 HP each turn but the seeder would recover 52 HP.

If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze , the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained. The seeded Pokémon can clear Leech Seed by switching out or using Rapid Spin .
Leech Seed.secondary_effect: User steals HP from the opponent every turn.

Leer.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Leer turns into Z-Leer and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Leer.detailed_effect:
Leer lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Let's Snuggle Forever.detailed_effect: Let's Snuggle Forever is a Fairy type Z-Move exclusive to Mimikyu . It is used with Play Rough .

Lick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lick turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.
Lick.detailed_effect:
Lick deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Life Dew.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Life Dew.detailed_effect: Life Dew recovers up to 25% of the user's and its teammate's maximum HP.
Life Dew.secondary_effect: Heals the Hit Points of the user and ally by 25%

Light of Ruin.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Light of Ruin turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 200.
Light of Ruin.detailed_effect: Light of Ruin deals damage, but the user receives 1/2 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 50 HP.
Light of Ruin.secondary_effect: User receives half the damage inflicted in recoil

Light Screen.effect: Halves damage from Special attacks for 5 turns.
Light Screen.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Light Screen.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Light Screen turns into Z-Light Screen and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Light Screen.detailed_effect:
Light Screen reduces damage from Special attacks by 50%, for 5 turns. Its effects apply to all Pokémon on the user's side of the field.

If the user is holding Light Clay when Light Screen is used, its effects last for 8 turns.

The move Brick Break , when used against an Pokémon under Light Screen's effect, will remove the screen before dealing damage. The ability Infiltrator bypasses the effects of Light Screen .

Light Screen is the Special counterpart to Reflect .
Light Screen.secondary_effect: Halves Special Attack damage inflicted on the user's side of the field

Light That Burns the Sky.effect: Ultra Necrozma-exclusive Z-Move. Ignores target's ability; uses highest Attack stat.
Light That Burns the Sky.detailed_effect:
Light That Burns the Sky is a Psychic type Z-Move exclusive to Necrozma . It is used with Photon Geyser .

Light That Burns the Sky ignores target's ability and inflicts damage based on the user's Attack or Special Attack, whichever is higher.

Liquidation.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Liquidation turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
Liquidation.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

Lock-On.effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.
Lock-On.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lock-On turns into Z-Lock-On and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Lock-On.detailed_effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.
Lock-On.secondary_effect: Ensures that user's next move will not fail.

Lovely Kiss.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lovely Kiss turns into Z-Lovely Kiss and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Lovely Kiss.detailed_effect:
Lovely Kiss puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

Low Kick.effect: The heavier the opponent, the stronger the attack.
Low Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Low Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.
Low Kick.detailed_effect:
Low Kick inflicts greater damage on heavier opponents , as shown in the table.

Low Kick is able to hit opponents hidden underwater from using Dive .
Low Kick.in_depth_effect: This attack's power is based on the target's weight. With as little as 20 Base Power, it can go as high as 120. The weight thresholds for determining base power are as follows: Under 10kg/22lbs: 20bp, 10.1kg - 25kg/22.1lbs - 55lbs: 40bp, 25.1kg - 50kg/55.1lbs - 110lbs: 60bp, 50.1kg - 100kg/110.1lbs - 220lbs: 80bp, 100.1kg - 200kg/220.1lbs - 440lbs: 100bp, Over 200kg/440lbs: 120bp
Low Kick.secondary_effect: Damage inflicted raises the heavier the opponent is.

Low Sweep.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Low Sweep turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.
Low Sweep.detailed_effect:
Low Sweep deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Lucky Chant.effect: Opponent cannot land critical hits for 5 turns.
Lucky Chant.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Lucky Chant.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lucky Chant turns into Z-Lucky Chant and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Lucky Chant.detailed_effect: Opponent cannot land critical hits for 5 turns.

Lumina Crash.secondary_effect: Lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages

Lunar Blessing.effect: Heals user's status conditions and recovers HP.
Lunar Blessing.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Lunar Blessing.detailed_effect: Lunar Blessing heals all status conditions of the user and its teammates, and restores 25% of their maximum HP.
Lunar Blessing.secondary_effect: Heals the user by % of maximum HP. Removes status conditions from the user

Lunar Dance.effect: The user faints but the next Pokémon released is fully healed.
Lunar Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lunar Dance has no additional effect.
Lunar Dance.detailed_effect: The user faints but the next Pokémon released is fully healed.
Lunar Dance.secondary_effect: Causes the user to faint and completely heals the next Pokémon

Lunge.effect: The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target's Attack stat.
Lunge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Lunge turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160.
Lunge.detailed_effect: The user makes a lunge at the target, attacking with full force. This also lowers the target's Attack stat. (100% chance)

Luster Purge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Luster Purge turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 140.
Luster Purge.detailed_effect:
Luster Purge deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Luster Purge.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

Mach Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mach Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Mach Punch.detailed_effect:
Mach Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1.

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

Magic Coat.effect: Reflects moves that cause status conditions back to the attacker.
Magic Coat.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magic Coat turns into Z-Magic Coat and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Magic Coat.detailed_effect: Magic Coat reflects any move causing status conditions - for example Thunder Wave or Toxic - back to the attacker. It applies only to the turn it is used.

Magic Room.effect: Suppresses the effects of held items for five turns.
Magic Room.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magic Room turns into Z-Magic Room and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Magic Room.detailed_effect: Magic Room suppresses the effects of held items for all Pokémon for five turns.
Magic Room.secondary_effect: Prevents hold item use for five turns.

Magical Leaf.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magical Leaf turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 120.
Magical Leaf.detailed_effect: Magical Leaf deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Magical Torque.detailed_effect:
Magical Torque deals damage and has a 30% chance of confusing the target.

Only the Revavroom used by Team Star has this move.

Magma Storm.effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Magma Storm.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magma Storm turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.
Magma Storm.detailed_effect:
Magma Storm inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.

If the user holds a Grip Claw , the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1/6 of the target's maximum HP.

Magnet Bomb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magnet Bomb turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 120.
Magnet Bomb.detailed_effect: Magnet Bomb deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Magnet Rise.effect: User becomes immune to Ground-type moves for 5 turns.
Magnet Rise.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magnet Rise turns into Z-Magnet Rise and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Magnet Rise.detailed_effect: User becomes immune to Ground-type moves for 5 turns.
Magnet Rise.secondary_effect: Gives user Ground-type immunity for 5 turns

Magnetic Flux.effect: Raises Defense and Sp. Defense of Plus/Minus Pokémon.
Magnetic Flux.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Magnetic Flux.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magnetic Flux turns into Z-Magnetic Flux and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Magnetic Flux.detailed_effect: Magnetic Flux raises the Defense and Special Defense of any Pokémon on the user's team that has the Plus or Minus ability.
Magnetic Flux.secondary_effect: Raises Defense and Special Defense of ally Pokémon with the Plus or Minus ability by 1 stage

Magnitude.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Magnitude turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 140.
Magnitude.detailed_effect:
The base power of Magnitude is one of 7 random values, with varying probability, as shown in the table.

Magnitude will hit with double power if the opponent is underground due to the move Dig .

Make It Rain.effect: Lowers user's Special Attack. Money is earned after the battle.
Make It Rain.detailed_effect: Lowers user's Special Attack. Money is earned after the battle.
Make It Rain.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Special Attack by one stage. Drops coins that can be picked up as money at the end of the battle

Malicious Moonsault.detailed_effect:
Malicious Moonsault is a Dark type Z-move exclusive to Incineroar . It is used with Incineroar's signature move Darkest Lariat .

If the target has used Minimize , Malicious Moonsault ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

Malignant Chain.detailed_effect: The user pours toxins into the target by wrapping them in a toxic, corrosive chain. This may also leave the target badly poisoned.

Mat Block.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Mat Block.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mat Block turns into Z-Mat Block and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Mat Block.detailed_effect: Mat Block protects the user's team from Physical or Special category moves, but not Status moves. It only works on the first turn the user is in battle.

Matcha Gotcha.effect: Deals damage, restores HP, may burn opponent.
Matcha Gotcha.detailed_effect: The user fires a blast of tea that it mixed. The user's HP is restored by up to half the damage taken by the target. This may also leave the target with a burn.
Matcha Gotcha.secondary_effect: Heals up to 50% of the damage inflicted on the enemy. May burn opponent

Max Airstream.effect: Flying type Dynamax move. Raises the team's Speed.
Max Airstream.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Airstream.detailed_effect:
Max Airstream is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Flying type moves turn into Max Airstream during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and raises the Speed of the user and its teammates. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Airstream.secondary_effect: Raises user and ally's Speed one stage.

Max Darkness.effect: Dark type Dynamax move. Lowers the target's Special Defense.
Max Darkness.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Darkness.detailed_effect:
Max Darkness is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Dark type moves turn into Max Darkness during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and lowers the target's Special Defense. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Darkness.secondary_effect: Lowers all opponent's Sp. Def one stage

Max Flare.effect: Fire type Dynamax move. Summons harsh sunlight.
Max Flare.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Flare.detailed_effect:
Max Flare is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Fire type moves turn into Max Flare during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and summons the harsh sunlight for 5 turns. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.

Max Flutterby.effect: Bug type Dynamax move. Lowers the target's Special Attack.
Max Flutterby.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Flutterby.detailed_effect:
Max Flutterby is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Bug type moves turn into Max Flutterby during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Flutterby.secondary_effect: Lowers all opponent's Special Attack one stage

Max Geyser.effect: Water type Dynamax move. Summons heavy rain.
Max Geyser.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Geyser.detailed_effect:
Max Geyser is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Water type moves turn into Max Geyser during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and summons heavy rain for 5 turns. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.

Max Guard.effect: Status category Dynamax move. Protects the user.
Max Guard.detailed_effect:
Max Guard is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Status category moves turn into Max Guard during Dynamax.

The move protects the user from attacks, like Protect .
Max Guard.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Max Guard.secondary_effect: Prevents being hit by the opponent's Attack. May fail on successive uses

Max Hailstorm.effect: Ice type Dynamax move. Summons hail.
Max Hailstorm.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Hailstorm.detailed_effect:
Max Hailstorm is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Ice type moves turn into Max Hailstorm during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and summons hail for 5 turns. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.

Max Knuckle.effect: Fighting type Dynamax move. Increases the team's Attack.
Max Knuckle.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Knuckle.detailed_effect:
Max Knuckle is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Fighting type moves turn into Max Knuckle during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and increases the Attack of the user and its teammates. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Knuckle.secondary_effect: Raises user and ally's Attack one stage.

Max Lightning.effect: Electric type Dynamax move. Summons Electric Terrain.
Max Lightning.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Lightning.detailed_effect:
Max Lightning is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Electric type moves turn into Max Lightning during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and summons Electric Terrain for 5 turns. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.

Max Mindstorm.effect: Psychic type Dynamax move. Summons Psychic Terrain.
Max Mindstorm.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Mindstorm.detailed_effect:
Max Overgrowth is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Grass type moves turn into Max Overgrowth during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and summons Psychic Terrain for 5 turns. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.

Max Ooze.effect: Poison type Dynamax move. Increases the team's Special Attack.
Max Ooze.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Ooze.detailed_effect:
Max Ooze is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Poison type moves turn into Max Ooze during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and increases the Special Attack of the user and its teammates. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Ooze.secondary_effect: Raises user and ally's Special Attack one stage.

Max Overgrowth.effect: Grass type Dynamax move. Summons Grassy Terrain.
Max Overgrowth.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Overgrowth.detailed_effect:
Max Overgrowth is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Grass type moves turn into Max Overgrowth during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and summons Grassy Terrain for 5 turns. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.

Max Phantasm.effect: Ghost type Dynamax move. Lowers the target's Defense.
Max Phantasm.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Phantasm.detailed_effect:
Max Phantasm is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Ghost type moves turn into Max Phantasm during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and lowers the target's Defense. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Phantasm.secondary_effect: Lowers all opponent's Defense one stage

Max Quake.effect: Ground type Dynamax move. Increases the team's Special Defense.
Max Quake.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Quake.detailed_effect:
Max Quake is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Ground type moves turn into Max Quake during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and increases the Special Defense of the user and its teammates. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Quake.secondary_effect: Raises user and ally's Sp. Def one stage.

Max Rockfall.effect: Rock type Dynamax move. Summons a sandstorm.
Max Rockfall.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Rockfall.detailed_effect:
Max Rockfall is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Rock type moves turn into Max Rockfall during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and summons a sandstorm for 5 turns. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.

Max Starfall.effect: Fairy type Dynamax move. Summons Misty Terrain.
Max Starfall.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Starfall.detailed_effect:
Max Starfall is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Fairy type moves turn into Max Starfall during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and summons Misty Terrain for 5 turns. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.

Max Steelspike.effect: Steel type Dynamax move. Raises the team's Defense.
Max Steelspike.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Steelspike.detailed_effect:
Max Steelspike is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Steel type moves turn into Max Steelspike during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and raises the Defense of the user and its teammates. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Steelspike.secondary_effect: Raises user and ally's Defense one stage.

Max Strike.effect: Normal type Dynamax move. Lowers the target's Speed.
Max Strike.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Strike.detailed_effect:
Max Strike is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Normal type moves turn into Max Strike during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and lowers the target's Speed. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Strike.secondary_effect: Lowers all opponent's Speed one stage

Max Wyrmwind.effect: Dragon type Dynamax move. Lowers the target's Attack.
Max Wyrmwind.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Max Wyrmwind.detailed_effect:
Max Wyrmwind is a Dynamax move from Pokémon Sword and Shield. Dragon type moves turn into Max Wyrmwind during Dynamax.

The move deals damage and lowers the target's Attack. The power and category depends on the original move selected, as shown in the table below.
Max Wyrmwind.secondary_effect: Lowers all opponent's Attack one stage

Me First.effect: User copies the opponent's attack with 1.5× power.
Me First.targets: Targets a single adjacent foe, but not an ally.
Me First.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Me First turns into Z-Me First and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Me First.detailed_effect:
If the opponent is readying a direct attack, the user of Me First will try to copy it and attack with 50% more power. The move only works if the user is faster than the opponent or otherwise able to move first (for example a Quick Claw activating).

Me First cannot copy Sucker Punch or Fake Out , nor by its definition above, any high priority move such as Extreme Speed . However it can copy a multi-turn move from any of its turns.

Mean Look.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mean Look turns into Z-Mean Look and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Meditate.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Meditate turns into Z-Meditate and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Meditate.detailed_effect:
Meditate raises the user's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Mega Drain.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on opponent.
Mega Drain.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mega Drain turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 120.
Mega Drain.detailed_effect:
Mega Drain deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained.

If the user is holding a Big Root , the move instead recovers 65% of the damage dealt (30% more than normal). If used on a Pokémon with the ability Liquid Ooze , the user instead loses the HP it would have otherwise gained.
Mega Drain.secondary_effect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

Mega Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mega Kick turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.
Mega Kick.detailed_effect: Mega Kick deals damage with no additional effect.

Mega Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mega Punch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Mega Punch.detailed_effect: Mega Punch deals damage with no additional effect.

Megahorn.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Megahorn turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 190.
Megahorn.detailed_effect: Megahorn deals damage with no additional effect.

Memento.effect: User faints, sharply lowers opponent's Attack and Special Attack.
Memento.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Memento turns into Z-Memento and fully restores the HP of the Pokémon switching in, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Memento.detailed_effect: User faints, sharply lowers opponent's Attack and Special Attack.
Memento.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Attack & Special Attack by two stages. User faints.

Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom.detailed_effect:
Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom is a Ghost type Z-Move exclusive to Lunala and Dawn Wings Necrozma , introduced in Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon . It is used with Lunala's signature move, Moongeist Beam .

Menacing Moonraze Maelstrom deals damage, ignoring the target's ability.

Metal Burst.effect: Deals damage equal to 1.5x opponent's attack.
Metal Burst.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Metal Burst turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 100.
Metal Burst.detailed_effect: Deals damage equal to 1. 5x opponent's attack.
Metal Burst.secondary_effect: Damages the last Pokémon to hit the user with 150% of the damage inflicted on the user

Metal Claw.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Metal Claw turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 100.
Metal Claw.detailed_effect:
Metal Claw deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Metal Claw.secondary_effect: May raise user's Attack one stage.

Metal Sound.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Metal Sound turns into Z-Metal Sound and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Metal Sound.detailed_effect:
Metal Sound lowers the target's Special Defense by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Metal Sound.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Special Defense two stages.

Meteor Assault.secondary_effect: User cannot Attack on the next turn.

Meteor Beam.effect: User gathers space power and boosts its Sp. Atk stat, then attacks the target on the next turn.
Meteor Beam.detailed_effect:
In this two-turn attack, the user gathers space power and boosts its Sp. Atk stat, then attacks the target on the next turn.

Meteor Beam is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.
Meteor Beam.secondary_effect: Increases Special Attack stat by 1 stage

Meteor Mash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Meteor Mash turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 175.
Meteor Mash.detailed_effect:
Meteor Mash deals damage and has a 20% chance of raising the user's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Meteor Mash.secondary_effect: May raise user's Attack one stage.

Metronome.effect: User performs almost any move in the game at random.
Metronome.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Metronome turns into Z-Metronome and becomes the Z-Move for the move selected (for example Tectonic Rage if Earthquake was chosen), in addition to its usual effect as above.
Metronome.detailed_effect:
Metronome uses a random move chosen from nearly all existing moves, even if the user cannot normally learn it.

The random move is chosen at the point Metronome is used, so priority moves like Mach Punch will not go first. Although Metronome technically targets the user, the move it turns into will use its usual target (whether the opponent(s), teammate(s) or self), or target a random adjacent opponent in double/triple battles.

Metronome will not select a Z-Move or any of the following moves:

If the user is holding a Choice Band , Choice Specs or Choice Scarf , multi-turn moves such as Dig or Rollout will fail on the second turn.
Metronome.in_depth_effect: This move selects and uses a random move. However, it cannot use the moves; Assist, Chatter, Copycat, Counter, Covet, Destiny Bond, Detect, Endure, Feint, Focus Punch, Follow Me, Helping Hand, Me First, Metronome, Mimic, Mirror Coat, Mirror Move, Protect, Quick Guard, Sketch, Sleep Talk, Snatch, Struggle, Switcheroo, Thief, Trick, or Wide Guard

Mighty Cleave.detailed_effect: The user wields the light that has accumulated atop its head to cleave the target. This move hits even if the target protects itself.

Milk Drink.effect: User recovers half its max HP.
Milk Drink.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Milk Drink turns into Z-Milk Drink and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Milk Drink.detailed_effect: Milk Drink recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
Milk Drink.secondary_effect: User recovers half the maximum HP.

Mimic.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mimic turns into Z-Mimic and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Mimic.detailed_effect:
Mimic copies the last move used by the target (replacing Mimic ). The copied move always has 5 PP. The effect only lasts while the user is in battle: if the user switches out or when the battle ends, the move becomes Mimic again.

Mimic cannot copy Chatter , Metronome , Sketch or Struggle .

Mind Blown.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mind Blown turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.
Mind Blown.detailed_effect:
Mind Blown deals damage, but the user sacrifices 1/2 of its maximum HP in recoil.

It can be learnt by UB Burst .
Mind Blown.secondary_effect: User loses half their Maximum Hit Points. This effect is ignored by Magic Guard.

Mind Reader.effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.
Mind Reader.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mind Reader turns into Z-Mind Reader and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Mind Reader.detailed_effect: User's next attack is guaranteed to hit.

Minimize.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Minimize turns into Z-Minimize and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Minimize.detailed_effect:
Minimize raises the user's Evasion by two stages, thus making the user more difficult to hit. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

The following moves deal double damage against a Pokémon that has used Minimize , and bypass accuracy checks:
Minimize.in_depth_effect: This move, while increasing your evasion, makes you more vulnerable to certain attacks. These attacks ignore the evasion boost and do double the original damage. These moves are: Body Slam, Dragon Rush, Flying Press, Heat Crash, Heavy Slam, Phantom Force, Steamroller, Stomp

Miracle Eye.effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, removes Dark's Psychic immunity.
Miracle Eye.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Miracle Eye turns into Z-Miracle Eye and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Miracle Eye.detailed_effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, removes Dark's Psychic immunity.

Mirror Coat.effect: When hit by a Special Attack, user strikes back with 2x power.
Mirror Coat.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mirror Coat turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 100.
Mirror Coat.detailed_effect: When hit by a Special Attack, user strikes back with 2x power.
Mirror Coat.secondary_effect: Counters the foe's special Attack at double the power.

Mirror Move.effect: User performs the opponent's last move.
Mirror Move.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mirror Move turns into Z-Mirror Move and raises Attack two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Mirror Move.detailed_effect: User performs the opponent's last move.

Mirror Shot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mirror Shot turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 120.
Mirror Shot.detailed_effect:
Mirror Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

Mist.effect: User's stats cannot be changed for a period of time.
Mist.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Mist.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mist turns into Z-Mist and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Mist.detailed_effect: User's stats cannot be changed for a period of time.

Mist Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mist Ball turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 140.
Mist Ball.detailed_effect:
Mist Ball deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Special Attack by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Mist Ball.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

Misty Explosion.detailed_effect:
The user attacks everything around it and faints upon using this move. This move’s power is increased on Misty Terrain.

Misty Explosion is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.
Misty Explosion.secondary_effect: Increases damage by 50% during Misty Terrain.

Misty Terrain.effect: Protects the field from status conditions for 5 turns.
Misty Terrain.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Misty Terrain turns into Z-Misty Terrain and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Misty Terrain.detailed_effect:
Misty Terrain creates a low-lying mist lasting 5 turns, that protects all grounded Pokémon from status conditions (including confusion). It also halves the power of Dragon type moves while in effect.

Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised . Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Misty Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.

The move Nature Power turns into Moonblast under Misty Terrain .
Misty Terrain.in_depth_effect: This move creates a terrain that helps Pokémon on the ground for 5 turns. It protects the Pokémon from status afflictions and halves the power of Dragon-type moves for Pokémon on the ground

Moonblast.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Moonblast turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 175.
Moonblast.detailed_effect: Moonblast deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Moonblast.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

Moongeist Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Moongeist Beam turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 180.

Moonlight.effect: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.
Moonlight.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Moonlight turns into Z-Moonlight and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Moonlight.detailed_effect: The user restores its own HP. The amount of HP regained varies with the weather.
Moonlight.in_depth_effect: This move recovers its HP depending upon the weather. If no weather is in effect, it heals the user by 50% of their maximum Hit Points. If Sunny Day is in effect, this move heals the user by 66.66% of its maximum Hit Points and if Rain Dance, Hail or Sandstorm is in effect, this move heals the user by 25% of their maximum Hit Points

Morning Sun.effect: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.
Morning Sun.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Morning Sun turns into Z-Morning Sun and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Morning Sun.detailed_effect: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.
Morning Sun.in_depth_effect: This move recovers its HP depending upon the weather. If no weather is in effect, it heals the user by 50% of their maximum Hit Points. If Sunny Day is in effect, this move heals the user by 66.66% of its maximum Hit Points and if Rain Dance, Hail or Sandstorm is in effect, this move heals the user by 25% of their maximum Hit Points

Mortal Spin.effect: Removes entry hazards and trap move effects, and poisons opposing Pokémon.
Mortal Spin.detailed_effect: Removes entry hazards and trap move effects, and poisons opposing Pokémon.

Mountain Gale.detailed_effect:
Mountain Gale deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Mud Bomb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud Bomb turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 120.
Mud Bomb.detailed_effect:
Mud Bomb deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

Mud Shot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud Shot turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.
Mud Shot.detailed_effect:
Mud Shot deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Mud Shot.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Speed one stage.

Mud Sport.effect: Weakens the power of Electric-type moves.
Mud Sport.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud Sport turns into Z-Mud Sport and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Mud Sport.detailed_effect:
Mud Sport reduces the power of Electric type moves by 50%. The effect applies to the entire field.

Most Pokémon that learn Mud Sport are part Ground type and thus already immune to Electric attacks.

Mud-Slap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mud-Slap turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.
Mud-Slap.detailed_effect:
Mud-Slap deals damage and lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Mud-Slap.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Accuracy one stage.

Muddy Water.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Muddy Water turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 175.
Muddy Water.detailed_effect:
Muddy Water deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Muddy Water.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Accuracy one stage.

Multi-Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Multi-Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 185.
Multi-Attack.detailed_effect: Multi-Attack is the signature move of Silvally. It deals damage with its type matching the Memory item held.
Multi-Attack.secondary_effect: Changes the type of the move based upon the item being held

Mystical Fire.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Mystical Fire turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 140.
Mystical Fire.detailed_effect: Mystical Fire deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.
Mystical Fire.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

Mystical Power.detailed_effect:
Mystical Power deals damage and raises the user's Special Attack by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Mystical Power.secondary_effect: Raises the user's Special Attack one stage

Nasty Plot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nasty Plot turns into Z-Nasty Plot and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Nasty Plot.detailed_effect:
Nasty Plot raises the user's Special Attack by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Nasty Plot.secondary_effect: Raises user's Special Attack two stages.

Natural Gift.effect: Power and type depend on the user's held berry.
Natural Gift.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Natural Gift turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Natural Gift.detailed_effect:
Natural Gift deals damage with no additional effects. However, its type and base power vary depending on the user's held Berry. The grid below shows which Berries provide which power and type.

For example, if a Pokémon holding a Cheri Berry uses Natural Gift , it will become a base power 60, Fire-type attack; holding a Starf Berry it will become an 80 power Psychic-type move.

Nature Power.effect: Uses a certain move based on the current terrain.
Nature Power.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nature Power turns into Z-Nature Power and becomes the Z-Move for the move selected (for example Hydro Vortex when on water), in addition to its usual effect as above.
Nature Power.detailed_effect:
When Nature Power is used it turns into a different move depending on the current battle terrain, as listed below.

Although it's a Normal type move, the user only receives STAB if the move it turns into is their type. For example, Sawsbuck (Normal/Grass) would not obtain STAB if Nature Power turned into Hydro Pump , but Ludicolo would.

Nature's Madness.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nature's Madness turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 100.
Nature's Madness.secondary_effect: Cuts the opponent's Hit Points by 50% of the current value.

Needle Arm.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Needle Arm turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 120.
Needle Arm.detailed_effect:
Needle Arm deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Never-Ending Nightmare.detailed_effect: Never-Ending Nightmare is the Ghost type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Night Daze.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Night Daze turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
Night Daze.detailed_effect:
Night Daze deals damage and has a 40% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Night Daze.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Accuracy one stage.

Night Shade.effect: Inflicts damage equal to user's level.
Night Shade.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Night Shade turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.
Night Shade.detailed_effect: The damage of Night Shade is equal to the user's level. So at level 100 the Pokémon will inflict 100 HP damage.
Night Shade.secondary_effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.

Night Slash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Night Slash turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 140.
Night Slash.detailed_effect: Night Slash deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Night Slash.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Nightmare.effect: The sleeping opponent loses 25% of its max HP each turn.
Nightmare.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nightmare turns into Z-Nightmare and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Nightmare.detailed_effect: If the target is asleep, Nightmare causes it to lose 1/4 of its maximum HP after each turn. The status condition is cured when the Pokémon wakes up.

No Retreat.effect: Raises all stats but user cannot switch out.
No Retreat.detailed_effect: Raises all stats but user cannot switch out. (100% chance)
No Retreat.secondary_effect: Increases each stat by 1 stage. Prevents user from fleeing

Noble Roar.effect: Lowers opponent's Attack and Special Attack.
Noble Roar.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Noble Roar turns into Z-Noble Roar and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Noble Roar.detailed_effect:
Noble Roar lowers the target's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Noble Roar.secondary_effect: Lowers target's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

Noxious Torque.detailed_effect:
Noxious Torque deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target.

Only the Revavroom used by Team Star has this move.

Nuzzle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Nuzzle turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.
Nuzzle.detailed_effect:
Nuzzle deals damage and paralyzes the target. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6 ).

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Oblivion Wing.effect: User recovers most of the HP inflicted on opponent.
Oblivion Wing.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Oblivion Wing turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 160.
Oblivion Wing.detailed_effect:
Oblivion Wing deals damage and the user will recover 75% of the HP drained.

Oblivion Wing is the signature move of Yveltal . In battle, the user flies high into the sky then releases a beam of red light that scorches the ground.

Obstruct.effect: Protects the user and sharply lowers Defence on contact.
Obstruct.detailed_effect:
Obstruct prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the user on that turn, the attacker's Defense is lowered by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Obstruct.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Obstruct.secondary_effect: Protects user. Lowers attacker's Defense stat by 2 stages if target makes physical contact

Oceanic Operetta.detailed_effect: Oceanic Operetta is a Water type Z-move exclusive to Primarina . It is used with Primarina's signature move Sparkling Aria .

Octazooka.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Octazooka turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 120.
Octazooka.detailed_effect:
Octazooka deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.
Octazooka.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Accuracy one stage.

Octolock.effect: Lowers opponent's Defense and Special Defense every turn, and they cannot flee or switch out.
Octolock.detailed_effect:
Octolock prevents the target from fleeing or switching out, while the user remains in battle. It also lowers the target's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each every turn.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Octolock.secondary_effect: Lowers target's Defense and Special Defense by 1 stage at the end of each turn. Prevents target from retreating

Odor Sleuth.effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, and allows Normal- and Fighting-type attacks to hit Ghosts.
Odor Sleuth.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Odor Sleuth turns into Z-Odor Sleuth and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Odor Sleuth.detailed_effect: Resets opponent's Evasiveness, and allows Normal- and Fighting-type attacks to hit Ghosts.

Ominous Wind.effect: May raise all user's stats at once.
Ominous Wind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Ominous Wind turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 120.
Ominous Wind.detailed_effect:
Ominous Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Order Up.effect: Boosts Attack/Defense/Speed depending on ally Tatsugiri.
Order Up.detailed_effect:
Order Up deals damage. If the user, Dondozo, has a Tatsugiri in its mouth, it also raises a particular stat depending on the form of Tatsugiri:

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Order Up.in_depth_effect: This move's effect changes depending on the Tatsugiri that has entered Dondozo's mouth. If Curly Form, then the user's Attack raises by one stage If Droopy Form, then user's Defense raises by one stage If Stretchy Form, then user's Speed raises by one stage.

Origin Pulse.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Origin Pulse turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.
Origin Pulse.detailed_effect:
Origin Pulse deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles.

It is the signature move of Kyogre .

Outrage.effect: User attacks for 2-3 turns but then becomes confused.
Outrage.targets: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.
Outrage.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Outrage turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 190.
Outrage.detailed_effect:
The user of Outrage attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

If Outrage is disrupted (e. g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Outrage.secondary_effect: User uses the same Attack for 2-3 turns then becomes confused.

structuredEffects.note: Guaranteed after 2-3 turns of attacking

Overheat.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Overheat turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 195.
Overheat.detailed_effect:
Overheat deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Overheat.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Special Attack two stages.

Pain Split.effect: The user's and opponent's HP becomes the average of both.
Pain Split.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pain Split turns into Z-Pain Split and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Pain Split.detailed_effect: The user's and opponent's HP becomes the average of both.
Pain Split.secondary_effect: User and opponent's Hit Points are added up and then shared equally

Parabolic Charge.effect: User recovers half the HP inflicted on opponent.
Parabolic Charge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Parabolic Charge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.
Parabolic Charge.detailed_effect: Parabolic Charge deals damage and the user will recover 50% of the HP drained. It targets all adjacent Pokémon.
Parabolic Charge.secondary_effect: User recovers half the damage inflicted.

Parting Shot.effect: Lowers opponent's Attack and Special Attack then switches out.
Parting Shot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Parting Shot turns into Z-Parting Shot and fully restores the HP of the Pokémon switching in, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Parting Shot.detailed_effect:
Parting Shot lowers the opponent's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each, then the user switches out of battle.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Parting Shot.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Attack & Special Attack stats by one stage. Pokémon switches out

Pay Day.effect: Money is earned after the battle.
Pay Day.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pay Day turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Pay Day.detailed_effect: Money is earned after the battle.
Pay Day.secondary_effect: User gains money after battle in the main game.

Payback.effect: Power doubles if the user was attacked first.
Payback.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Payback turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.
Payback.detailed_effect: Power doubles if the user was attacked first.
Payback.secondary_effect: Doubles damage if user moves after target

structuredEffects.note: Power doubles if user was attacked first

Peck.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Peck.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Peck turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 100.
Peck.detailed_effect: Peck deals damage with no additional effect, besides being able to hit non-adjacent Pokémon in triple battles.

structuredEffects.note: Pure damage with no additional effect

Perish Song.effect: Any Pokémon in play when this attack is used faints in 3 turns.
