Perish Song.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Perish Song turns into Z-Perish Song and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Perish Song.detailed_effect: Any Pokémon in play when this attack is used faints in 3 turns.
Perish Song.secondary_effect: All Pokémon on the field faint in 3 turns.

Petal Blizzard.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Petal Blizzard turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 175.
Petal Blizzard.detailed_effect:
Petal Blizzard deals damage with no additional effect.

In double battles it will hit all Pokémon on the field; in triple battles it will hit all adjacent Pokémon.

structuredEffects.note: No additional effect

Petal Dance.effect: User attacks for 2-3 turns but then becomes confused.
Petal Dance.targets: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.
Petal Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Petal Dance turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.
Petal Dance.detailed_effect:
The user of Petal Dance attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

If Petal Dance is disrupted (e. g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Petal Dance.secondary_effect: User uses the same Attack for 2-3 turns then becomes confused.

structuredEffects.note: Guaranteed after 2-3 turns of attacking

Phantom Force.effect: Disappears on first turn, attacks on second. Can strike through Protect/Detect.
Phantom Force.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Phantom Force turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 175.
Phantom Force.detailed_effect: Phantom Force causes the user to disappear on the first turn, becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, it deals damage and can hit Pokémon using Protect or Detect .
Phantom Force.secondary_effect: The user is protected the first turn, Attacks the second turn. Hits through Protect

Photon Geyser.effect: Uses Attack or Special Attack stat, whichever is higher.
Photon Geyser.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Photon Geyser turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 180.
Photon Geyser.detailed_effect: Photon Geyser deals damage, but uses either the user's Attack or Special Attack stat to determine its power, whichever is higher.
Photon Geyser.secondary_effect: Damage inflicted depends on user's Attack or Special Attack. Highest stat used to determine if move is Physical or Special. Ignores abilities

Pika Papow.effect: Power increases when player's bond is stronger.
Pika Papow.detailed_effect:
Pika Papow is a Pikachu-exclusive Partner Power from Pokémon Let's Go. The power increases when Pikachu's Friendship is higher (similar to Return ), up to a maximum base power of 102 .

When a different Pokémon is in battle, Pika Papow may be used to boost that Pokémon's stats.

Pin Missile.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pin Missile turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 140.
Pin Missile.detailed_effect:
Pin Missile hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Pin Missile is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Pin Missile to always hit the maximum number of times.
Pin Missile.secondary_effect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

Plasma Fists.effect: Changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.
Plasma Fists.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Plasma Fists turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 180.
Plasma Fists.detailed_effect: Changes Normal-type moves to Electric-type moves.
Plasma Fists.secondary_effect: Changes target's Normal-type move to Electric-type.

Play Nice.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Play Nice turns into Z-Play Nice and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Play Nice.detailed_effect:
Play Nice lowers the target's Attack by one stage. The move always hits, even if the target used a Protect -like move.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Play Rough.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Play Rough turns into Twinkle Tackle and has base power 175.
Play Rough.detailed_effect:
Play Rough deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Play Rough.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Attack one stage.

Pluck.effect: If the opponent is holding a berry, its effect is stolen by user.
Pluck.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Pluck.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pluck turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.
Pluck.detailed_effect: If the opponent is holding a berry, its effect is stolen by user.
Pluck.secondary_effect: Removes target's Berry and uses its effect

Poison Fang.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Fang turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.
Poison Fang.detailed_effect: Poison Fang deals damage and has a 50% chance of badly poisoning the target. Badly poisoned Pokémon will lose an increasing amount of HP at the end of each turn.

Poison Gas.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Gas turns into Z-Poison Gas and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Poison Gas.detailed_effect:
Poison Gas causes the target to become poisoned. Poisoned Pokémon lose 1/8 of their maximum HP each turn.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Poison Jab.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Jab turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 160.
Poison Jab.detailed_effect:
Poison Jab deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Poison Powder.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Powder turns into Z-Poison Powder and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Poison Powder.detailed_effect:
Poison Powder causes the target to become poisoned. Poisoned Pokémon lose 1/8 of their maximum HP each turn.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Poison Sting.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Sting turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.
Poison Sting.detailed_effect:
Poison Sting deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Poison Tail.effect: High critical hit ratio. May poison opponent.
Poison Tail.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Poison Tail turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.
Poison Tail.detailed_effect:
Poison Tail deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target. It also has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.
Poison Tail.secondary_effect: Has high critical hit ratio. May induce poison.

Pollen Puff.effect: Deals damage to opponent or restores HP of teammate.
Pollen Puff.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pollen Puff turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 175.
Pollen Puff.detailed_effect: Deals damage to opponent or restores HP of teammate.
Pollen Puff.secondary_effect: Heals if used on an ally.

Poltergeist.effect: Fails if the target doesn’t have an item.
Poltergeist.detailed_effect:
The user attacks the target by controlling the target’s item. The move fails if the target doesn’t have an item.

Poltergeist is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

structuredEffects.note: Uniform distribution 1-10 hits

Pound.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pound turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Pound.detailed_effect: Pound deals damage with no additional effect.

structuredEffects.note: Pure damage with no additional effect

Powder.effect: Damages Pokémon using Fire type moves.
Powder.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Powder turns into Z-Powder and raises Special Defense two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Powder.detailed_effect: Powder moves with priority and covers the target in a powder that lasts for the rest of the current turn only. It damages the target if they use a Fire type move in that turn, and prevents the Fire move from working.

Powder Snow.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Powder Snow turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 100.
Powder Snow.detailed_effect:
Powder Snow deals damage and has a 10% chance of freezing the target.

Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

Power Gem.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Gem turns into Continental Crush and has base power 160.
Power Gem.detailed_effect: Power Gem deals damage with no additional effect.

structuredEffects.note: Pure damage with no additional effect

Power Shift.detailed_effect: Power Shift switches the user's Attack stat with its Defense.

Power Split.effect: Averages Attack and Special Attack with the target.
Power Split.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Split turns into Z-Power Split and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Power Split.detailed_effect:
Power Split averages the user's Attack and Special Attack with those of the target. Stat boosts are not taken into account. The effect lasts until the battle ends or the Pokémon switches out.

For example, if the user's Attack was 100, the opponent's was 200, and the opponent had used Swords Dance , then both Pokémon would end up with 150 Attack. Due to the stat boost, the opponent's effective Attack would now be 300 (instead of the 400 it was originally).

Power Swap.effect: User and opponent swap Attack and Special Attack.
Power Swap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Swap turns into Z-Power Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Power Swap.detailed_effect: User and opponent swap Attack and Special Attack.
Power Swap.secondary_effect: Switches user's Attack & SP. ATT stat increases with opponent.

Power Trick.effect: User's own Attack and Defense switch.
Power Trick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Trick turns into Z-Power Trick and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Power Trick.detailed_effect: User's own Attack and Defense switch.

Power Trip.effect: The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user's stats are raised, the greater the move's power.
Power Trip.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Trip turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
Power Trip.detailed_effect: The user boasts its strength and attacks the target. The more the user's stats are raised, the greater the move's power.
Power Trip.in_depth_effect: This attack's power starts off with 20 Base Power but increases by 20 Base Power for each stat increase used by the Pokémon. Can get a maximum Base Power of 860. Moves with stat lowering effects do not affect this move's power.
Power Trip.secondary_effect: Increases damage by 20 Base Points for each stage a stat has been increased by the user

Power Whip.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power Whip turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.
Power Whip.detailed_effect: Power Whip deals damage with no additional effect.

structuredEffects.note: Pure damage with no additional effect

Power-Up Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Power-Up Punch turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Power-Up Punch.detailed_effect:
Power-Up Punch deals damage and raises the user's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Precipice Blades.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Precipice Blades turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 190.
Precipice Blades.detailed_effect:
Precipice Blades deals damage and hits all adjacent opponents in double/triple battles.

It is the signature move of Groudon .

structuredEffects.note: Groudon's signature move

Present.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Present turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Present.in_depth_effect: This move has got four different possibilities for outcomes 40% - Base Power of 40, 30% - Base Power of 80, 20% - Heal 25% of target's max HP, 10% - Base Power of 120.
Present.secondary_effect: May hit or heal the user or the opponent.

Prismatic Laser.effect: The user shoots powerful lasers using the power of a prism. The user can't move on the next turn.
Prismatic Laser.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Prismatic Laser turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 200.
Prismatic Laser.detailed_effect: The user shoots powerful lasers using the power of a prism. The user can't move on the next turn.
Prismatic Laser.secondary_effect: User cannot Attack on the next turn.

Protect.effect: Protects the user, but may fail if used consecutively.
Protect.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Protect turns into Z-Protect and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Protect.detailed_effect:
Protect prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves. The move functions identically to Detect .

The accuracy of Protect decreases by 1/3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Detect , Endure , Wide Guard , Quick Guard , Spiky Shield , King's Shield , or Baneful Bunker .

Damage-dealing Z-Moves bypass Protect but deal 1/4 of the damage.
Protect.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Protect.secondary_effect: Prevents being hit by the opponent's Attack. May fail on successive uses

structuredEffects.note: Succeeding protection moves reduce accuracy by 1/3 each use

Psybeam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psybeam turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 120.
Psybeam.detailed_effect:
Psybeam deals damage and has a 10% chance of confusing the target.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

Psyblade.detailed_effect: Psyblade deals damage, and its power is boosted by 50% on Electric Terrain.

Psych Up.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psych Up turns into Z-Psych Up and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Psychic.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 175.
Psychic.detailed_effect:
Psychic deals damage and has a 10% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Psychic.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

Psychic Fangs.effect: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect.
Psychic Fangs.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic Fangs turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.
Psychic Fangs.detailed_effect: The user bites the target with its psychic capabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen and Reflect.
Psychic Fangs.in_depth_effect: This move will remove any Reflect, Light Screen, Aurora Veil or that is in play on the opponent's team.

Psychic Noise.effect: Deals damage and prevents target from healing.
Psychic Noise.detailed_effect: Deals damage and prevents target from healing.
Psychic Noise.secondary_effect: Prevents opposing team from using any healing moves, items or abilities for 2 turns

Psychic Terrain.effect: Prevents priority moves from being used for 5 turns.
Psychic Terrain.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psychic Terrain turns into Z-Psychic Terrain and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Psychic Terrain.detailed_effect:
Psychic Terrain creates a low-lying psychic field lasting 5 turns, that prevents grounded Pokémon from being hit by high-priority moves (such as Quick Attack or Sucker Punch ). The power of Psychic type moves also increases while in effect.

Grounded Pokémon are simply those that are not raised . Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Psychic Terrain is a terrain condition and can coexist at the same time as weather conditions, but not other terrain conditions.

The move Nature Power turns into Psychic under Psychic Terrain .
Psychic Terrain.in_depth_effect: This move creates a terrain that helps Pokémon on the ground for 5 turns. It prevents all Pokémon on the ground from using attacks or being targeted by attacks with increased priority from opposing Pokémon, and boosts the power of Psychic-type moves on grounded Pokémon by 30%

Psycho Boost.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Boost turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 200.
Psycho Boost.detailed_effect:
Psycho Boost deals damage but lowers the user's Special Attack by two stages after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Psycho Boost.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Special Attack two stages.

Psycho Cut.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Cut turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 140.
Psycho Cut.detailed_effect: Psycho Cut deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Psycho Cut.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

structuredEffects.note: 1/8 crit chance instead of 1/24

Psycho Shift.effect: Transfers user's status condition to the opponent.
Psycho Shift.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psycho Shift turns into Z-Psycho Shift and raises Special Attack two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Psycho Shift.detailed_effect:
Psycho Shift transfers any major status condition the user has (Poison, Burn, Paralysis, Sleep, Freeze) to the target, if the target does not already have a status condition.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned. Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.

Psyshield Bash.effect: Raises user's Defense and Special Defense.
Psyshield Bash.detailed_effect:
Psyshield Bash deals damage and raises the user's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Psyshock.effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
Psyshock.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psyshock turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.
Psyshock.detailed_effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.

Psystrike.effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
Psystrike.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psystrike turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 180.
Psystrike.detailed_effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.

Psywave.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Psywave turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 100.
Psywave.detailed_effect:
Psywave inflicts a random amount of HP damage, varying between 50% and 150% of the user's level. In other words, at level 100 the damage will be 50-150 HP .

The damage is typeless (not affected by type advantages/disadvantages) but it still does not hit Dark type Pokémon.

Pulverizing Pancake.detailed_effect: Pulverizing Pancake is a Normal type Z-Move exclusive to Snorlax . It is used with Giga Impact .

Punishment.effect: Power increases when opponent's stats have been raised.
Punishment.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Punishment turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
Punishment.detailed_effect:
Punishment deals varying damage based on the opponent's stat increases. It starts at base power 60 and increases by 20 for every net stat boost of the opponent, up to a maximum of 200 (7 boosts). In other words the power is:

For example, if the opponent used Nasty Plot and Agility once each, that is a total of 4 stat increases (+2 Special Attack, +2 Speed) and Punishment's base power will be 20 × 4 + 60 = 140 .

Purify.effect: The user heals the target's status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user's own HP.
Purify.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Purify turns into Z-Purify and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Purify.detailed_effect: The user heals the target's status condition. If the move succeeds, it also restores the user's own HP.
Purify.secondary_effect: Heals target's Status Condition. Heals user by 25% of maxmum Hit Points

Pursuit.effect: Double power if the opponent is switching out.
Pursuit.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Pursuit turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.
Pursuit.detailed_effect:
Pursuit deals damage, and hits with double power if the target is switching out.

In that case, Pursuit technically has priority +7, meaning it attacks before all other actions and moves.

Quash.effect: Makes the target act last this turn.
Quash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quash turns into Z-Quash and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Quash.detailed_effect:
Quash forces the target Pokémon to move last in the current turn.

It does not have priority so will fail if the target already moved in the current turn. Therefore it is useless in single battles and only works in double/triple battles.
Quash.secondary_effect: Target Pokémon moves last in the turn

Quick Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quick Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Quick Attack.detailed_effect:
Quick Attack deals damage and has a priority of +1.

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

Quick Guard.effect: Protects the user's team from high-priority moves.
Quick Guard.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Quick Guard.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quick Guard turns into Z-Quick Guard and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Quick Guard.detailed_effect:
Quick Guard protects the user's team from all increased priority moves (such as Extreme Speed or Bullet Punch ), for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves.

The accuracy of Quick Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Wide Guard . However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect , Detect , Endure , Spiky Shield , King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by 1/3 each time it or Wide Guard is used.
Quick Guard.in_depth_effect: Unlike Protect, which works on all moves, Quick Guard prevents only and all effects from moves with a heightened Speed Priority. In addition to that, it also protects all the player's Pokémon on the field rather than just the user. However, even though it blocks all moves with a Speed Priority of 1 or higher, higher priority moves which execute before this one (or equal priority moves from a pokemon earlier in the turn order) will still succeed. The move Feint will hit through this move, as it does with Protect and Detect. This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Quick Guard.secondary_effect: Protects ally Pokémon from moves with increased Speed Priority

Quiver Dance.effect: Raises user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed.
Quiver Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Quiver Dance turns into Z-Quiver Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Quiver Dance.detailed_effect:
Quiver Dance raises the user's Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Quiver Dance.secondary_effect: Raises user's Special Attack, Special Defense & Speed by one stage.

Rage.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rage turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Rage.detailed_effect:
Rage deals damage, and if the user is hit by a direct attack - any time after Rage is first used but before a different move is used - the user's Attack is raised by one stage. The game will state the Pokémon's rage is building rather than explicitly assert the stat increase. Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

The Attack increases will continue as long as Rage is the last move used, even if it misses, the user is incapacitated (paralyzed, sleeping, etc) or the player uses an item. The Attack increase activates for every blow of multi-hit moves such as Double Slap or Fury Swipes .

As an example, if a Pokémon uses Rage then the opponent hits the user in the same turn, the user's Attack increases. If the user moves last it will not increase that turn, but will in the next turn if the opponent hits the user again.

structuredEffects.note: Raises attack by 1 for each hit received while Rage is active

Rage Fist.effect: The more times the user has been hit by attacks, the greater the move's power.
Rage Fist.detailed_effect: The more times the user has been hit by attacks, the greater the move's power.
Rage Fist.in_depth_effect: This move increases in power by 50BP for every time the user has been hit by an attack from any opponent including allies. This caps at maxing with a base power of 350.
Rage Fist.secondary_effect: Increases base power by 50 based on how many times the user has been hit by damage from other Pokémon's attacks

Rage Powder.effect: Forces attacks to hit user, not team-mates.
Rage Powder.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rage Powder turns into Z-Rage Powder and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Rage Powder.detailed_effect:
Rage Powder redirects all single-target moves used by opponents to itself. It is only useful in double or triple battles.

It does not work for moves that target multiple Pokémon such as Air Cutter or Bulldoze .
Rage Powder.secondary_effect: Draws Attacks towards the user rather than ally

Raging Bull.effect: Type depends on the user’s form. Breaks through Reflect and Light Screen barriers.
Raging Bull.detailed_effect: Type depends on the user’s form. Breaks through Reflect and Light Screen barriers.
Raging Bull.in_depth_effect: This move's type changes based on the user's form. If Combat Breed, the move is a Fighting-type move If Blaze Breed, the move is a Fire-type move If Aqua Breed, the move is a Water-type move.

Raging Fury.effect: User attacks for 2-3 turns but then becomes confused.
Raging Fury.targets: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.
Raging Fury.detailed_effect:
The user of Raging Fury attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

If Raging Fury is disrupted (e. g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Raging Fury.secondary_effect: User uses the same Attack for 2-3 turns then becomes confused.

structuredEffects.note: Guaranteed after 2-3 turns of attacking

Rain Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rain Dance turns into Z-Rain Dance and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Rain Dance.detailed_effect: Rain Dance causes a rain shower that lasts for 5 turns, and induces these additional effects:

structuredEffects.note: Can be extended by Light Clay to 8 turns

Rapid Spin.effect: Raises user's Speed and removes entry hazards and trap move effects.
Rapid Spin.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rapid Spin turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Rapid Spin.detailed_effect: Rapid Spin deals damage, raises the user's Speed by one stage, and removes the effects of several trap moves and entry hazards. It fails if the move misses or the target is immune. The effects from the following moves are removed:
Rapid Spin.secondary_effect: User removes trapping moves. Increased Speed by 1 stage.

Razor Leaf.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Leaf turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.
Razor Leaf.detailed_effect: Razor Leaf deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Razor Leaf.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

structuredEffects.note: 1/8 crit chance instead of 1/24

Razor Shell.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Shell turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 140.
Razor Shell.detailed_effect:
Razor Shell deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Razor Shell.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

Razor Wind.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second. High critical hit ratio.
Razor Wind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Razor Wind turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Razor Wind.detailed_effect:
The user of Razor Wind will whip up a whirlwind on the first turn. On the second turn, Razor Wind deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

If the user is holding a Power Herb , Razor Wind executes in one turn.

Recover.effect: User recovers half its max HP.
Recover.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Recover turns into Z-Recover and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Recover.detailed_effect: Recover restores up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
Recover.secondary_effect: User recovers half the maximum HP.

Recycle.effect: User's used hold item is restored.
Recycle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Recycle turns into Z-Recycle and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Recycle.detailed_effect: User's used hold item is restored.
Recycle.secondary_effect: Recycles an already used held item.

Reflect.effect: Halves damage from Physical attacks for 5 turns.
Reflect.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Reflect.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reflect turns into Z-Reflect and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Reflect.detailed_effect:
Reflect reduces damage from Physical attacks by 50%, for 5 turns. Its effects apply to all Pokémon on the user's side of the field.

If the user is holding Light Clay when Reflect is used, its effects last for 8 turns.

The move Brick Break , when used against an Pokémon under Reflect's effect, will remove the screen before dealing damage. The ability Infiltrator bypasses the effects of Reflect .

Reflect is the Physical counterpart to Light Screen .
Reflect.secondary_effect: Halves Attack damage inflicted on the user's side of the field

Reflect Type.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reflect Type turns into Z-Reflect Type and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Reflect Type.detailed_effect: Reflect Type changes the user's type to match the type(s) of the target.

Refresh.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Refresh turns into Z-Refresh and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Relic Song.effect: May put the target to sleep.
Relic Song.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Relic Song turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Relic Song.detailed_effect: May put the target to sleep. (10% chance)
Relic Song.secondary_effect: May induce SLEEP. Changes Meloetta's Form

Rest.effect: User sleeps for 2 turns, but user is fully healed.
Rest.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rest turns into Z-Rest and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Rest.detailed_effect: User sleeps for 2 turns, but user is fully healed.

structuredEffects.note: User sleeps for 2 turns (self-inflicted)

Retaliate.effect: Inflicts double damage if a teammate fainted on the last turn.
Retaliate.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Retaliate turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Retaliate.detailed_effect: Inflicts double damage if a teammate fainted on the last turn.
Retaliate.secondary_effect: If a team-mate has been knocked out in the turn before this Pokémon moves, the power is increased by 100%.

Return.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Return turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Return.detailed_effect:
The power of Return is higher when the user likes its trainer more. The base power varies between 1 (minimum Friendship) and 102 (maximum Friendship). The exact formula is:

Pokémon Friendship (aka Happiness) is a value between 0 and 255 ( more details ).

Return is the counterpart move to Frustration .

Revelation Dance.effect: Type changes based on Oricorio's form.
Revelation Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Revelation Dance turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
Revelation Dance.detailed_effect: Revelation Dance deals damage with a different type depending on the style of Oricorio:
Revelation Dance.in_depth_effect: This move changes type based on the user's type. This also changes to the user's Tera Type if the user has Terastallized

structuredEffects.note: Type matches user's current type or Tera Type

Revenge.effect: Power increases if user was hit first.
Revenge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Revenge turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.
Revenge.detailed_effect: Power increases if user was hit first.

structuredEffects.note: Power increases if user was hit first

Reversal.effect: The lower the user's HP, the higher the power.
Reversal.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Reversal turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.
Reversal.detailed_effect: Reversal deals more damage the lower the user's HP is, as per the table below.
Reversal.secondary_effect: Inflicts more damage when the user's HP is down.

Revival Blessing.effect: Revives a fainted party Pokémon to half HP.
Revival Blessing.detailed_effect: Revives a fainted party Pokémon to half HP.
Revival Blessing.secondary_effect: Revives a fainted Pokémon up to 50% maximum Hit Points

Rising Voltage.detailed_effect:
The user attacks with electric voltage rising from the ground. This move’s power doubles when the target is on Electric Terrain.

Rising Voltage is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Roar.effect: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.
Roar.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Roar turns into Z-Roar and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Roar.detailed_effect:
In the wild, Roar causes the target Pokémon to flee if they are of a lower level, and the battle ends.

In trainer battles (including linked battles), Roar forces the target to switch out of battle (regardless of level) and is replaced with another Pokémon in the trainer's team.

Pokémon with the abilities Soundproof or Suction Cups or those rooted by Ingrain are not affected by Roar .

Roar of Time.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Roar of Time turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 200.
Roar of Time.secondary_effect: User cannot Attack on the next turn.

Rock Blast.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Blast turns into Continental Crush and has base power 140.
Rock Blast.detailed_effect:
Rock Blast hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Rock Blast is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Rock Blast to always hit the maximum number of times.
Rock Blast.secondary_effect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

Rock Climb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Climb turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
Rock Climb.detailed_effect:
Rock Climb deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

Rock Polish.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Polish turns into Z-Rock Polish and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Rock Polish.detailed_effect:
Rock Polish raises the user's Speed by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Rock Slide.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Slide turns into Continental Crush and has base power 140.
Rock Slide.detailed_effect:
Rock Slide deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Rock Smash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Smash turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Rock Smash.detailed_effect:
Rock Smash deals damage and has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Rock Smash.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

Rock Throw.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Throw turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.
Rock Throw.detailed_effect: Rock Throw deals damage with no additional effect.

structuredEffects.note: Pure damage with no additional effect

Rock Tomb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Tomb turns into Continental Crush and has base power 120.
Rock Tomb.detailed_effect:
Rock Tomb deals damage and lowers the target's Speed by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Rock Tomb.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Speed one stage.

Rock Wrecker.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rock Wrecker turns into Continental Crush and has base power 200.
Rock Wrecker.secondary_effect: User cannot Attack on the next turn.

Role Play.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Role Play turns into Z-Role Play and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Role Play.detailed_effect:
Role Play copies the opponent's ability, replacing its own with that of the target's.

Role Play does not work on Pokémon with Wonder Guard or Multitype .
Role Play.in_depth_effect: This move changes the user's abiliy to that of the target Pokémon. Doesn't work on Pokémon with the Wonder Guard ability.

Rolling Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rolling Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.
Rolling Kick.detailed_effect:
Rolling Kick deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Rollout.effect: Doubles in power each turn for 5 turns.
Rollout.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rollout turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.
Rollout.detailed_effect:
Rollout deals damage for 5 turns, doubling in power each turn. The move stops if it misses on any turn. If it doesn't miss, Rollout will deal 30, 60, 120, 240 and 480 base power damage each turn respectively.

If the user has used Defense Curl in any previous turn (without switching out) then Rollout doubles in power, i. e. it will deal 60, 120, 240, 480 and 960 base power damage respectively.

As Rollout has 90% accuracy, the chances of it being successful for each turn (with normal Accuracy/Evasion and no other interruptions) are 90%, 81%, 73%, 66% and 59% respectively. In other words, roughly 3 out of every 5 times Rollout is used, it will hit for the full 5 turns.
Rollout.secondary_effect: Uses the same move for 5 turns; move's power raises if it hits.

Roost.effect: User recovers half of its max HP and loses the Flying type temporarily.
Roost.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Roost turns into Z-Roost and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Roost.detailed_effect: User recovers half of its max HP and loses the Flying type temporarily.
Roost.secondary_effect: Heals up to 50% of maximum Hit Points. Flying-type Pokémon are no longer Flying-type for the rest of the turn.

Rototiller.effect: Raises Attack and Special Attack of Grass-types.
Rototiller.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Rototiller turns into Z-Rototiller and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Rototiller.detailed_effect:
Rototiller raises the Attack and Special Attack of any Grass-type Pokémon on the field by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Round.effect: Power increases if teammates use it in the same turn.
Round.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Round turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.
Round.detailed_effect: Round deals damage. If multiple Pokémon on the same team use it in the same turn, the power doubles to 120 and the slower Pokémon move immediately after the fastest Pokémon uses it, regardless of their Speed.
Round.in_depth_effect: This move increases in power when used by different Pokémon on your side in a single turn. When Round is used by multiple Pokémon, the Pokémon will immediately use it, regardless of Speed or Priority. Each consecutive use of this move has the power doubled up until it hits the maximum of 240.
Round.secondary_effect: Increases power if other Pokémon used Round this turn

Ruination.secondary_effect: Cuts the opponent's Hit Points by 50% of the current value

Sacred Fire.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sacred Fire turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.
Sacred Fire.detailed_effect:
Sacred Fire deals damage and has a 50% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

If the user is frozen, Sacred Fire can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

Sacred Sword.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sacred Sword turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 175.
Sacred Sword.detailed_effect:
Sacred Sword deals damage, but ignores changes to the target's stats (i. e. Defense and Evasion in this case).

Note this does not include the effects of screens like Reflect as they are different to regular stat boosts.

Safeguard.effect: The user's party is protected from status conditions.
Safeguard.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Safeguard.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Safeguard turns into Z-Safeguard and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Safeguard.detailed_effect: The user's party is protected from status conditions.
Safeguard.secondary_effect: Prevents all status conditions for five turns

Salt Cure.effect: Deals damage each turn; Steel and Water types are more affected.
Salt Cure.detailed_effect: Deals damage each turn; Steel and Water types are more affected.
Salt Cure.secondary_effect: Inflicts damage on the target at the end of each turn. Doubles damage inflicted on Water or Steel-type opponents

Sand Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sand Attack turns into Z-Sand Attack and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sand Attack.detailed_effect:
Sand Attack lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage. Although it is a Ground -type move it still affects raised Pokémon. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

Sand Tomb.effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Sand Tomb.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Sand Tomb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sand Tomb turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 100.
Sand Tomb.detailed_effect:
Sand Tomb inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.

If the user holds a Grip Claw , the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1/6 of the target's maximum HP.

Sandsear Storm.detailed_effect:
Sandsear Storm deals damage and has a 20% chance of burning the target. The move targets both opponents in a double battle (each with a 20% chance of burning).

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

If used during rain , Sandsear Storm ignores accuracy.
Sandsear Storm.in_depth_effect: This move increases in accuracy to 100% during rain.

Sandstorm.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sandstorm turns into Z-Sandstorm and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sandstorm.detailed_effect: Sandstorm creates a sandstorm on the battlefield that lasts for 5 turns and induces these additional effects:

Sappy Seed.effect: Drains HP from opponent each turn.
Sappy Seed.detailed_effect:
Sappy Seed deals damage and plants a seed on the target that drains 1/8 of its maximum HP at the end of each turn (similar to Leech Seed ).

Sappy Seed is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble , Buzzy Buzz , Sizzly Slide , Glitzy Glow , Baddy Bad , Freezy Frost , and Sparkly Swirl .

Savage Spin-Out.detailed_effect: Savage Spin-Out is the Bug type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Scald.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scald turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
Scald.detailed_effect:
Scald deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

If the user is frozen, Scald can be used and will thaw out the Pokémon before attacking.

Scale Shot.effect: Hits 2-5 times in one turn. Boosts user's Speed but lowers its Defense.
Scale Shot.detailed_effect:
The user attacks by shooting scales two to five times in a row. This move boosts the user’s Speed stat but lowers its Defense stat.

Scale Shot is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.
Scale Shot.secondary_effect: Increases Speed by 1 stage. Lowers Defense by 1 Stage

Scary Face.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scary Face turns into Z-Scary Face and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Scary Face.detailed_effect:
Scary Face lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Scorching Sands.detailed_effect:
The user throws scorching sand at the target to attack. This may also leave the target with a burn.

Scorching Sands is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Scratch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Scratch turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Scratch.detailed_effect: Scratch is one of the most common and basic moves a Pokémon learns. It deals damage with no additional effects.

Screech.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Screech turns into Z-Screech and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Screech.detailed_effect:
Screech lowers the target's Defense by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Searing Shot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Searing Shot turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 180.
Searing Shot.detailed_effect:
Searing Shot deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Searing Sunraze Smash.detailed_effect:
Searing Sunraze Smash is a Steel type Z-Move exclusive to Solgaleo and Dusk Mane Necrozma , introduced in Pokémon Ultra Sun & Ultra Moon . It is used with Solgaleo's signature move, Sunsteel Strike .

Searing Sunraze Smash deals damage, ignoring the target's ability.

Secret Power.effect: Effects of the attack vary with the location.
Secret Power.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Secret Power turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Secret Power.detailed_effect: Secret Power deals damage and has a 30% chance of inducing a secondary effect on the opponent, depending on the environment. The move's animation also changes, reusing that of a specific attack for each terrain.

Secret Sword.effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.
Secret Sword.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Secret Sword turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.
Secret Sword.detailed_effect: Inflicts damage based on the target's Defense, not Special Defense.

Seed Bomb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Seed Bomb turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 160.
Seed Bomb.detailed_effect: Seed Bomb deals damage with no additional effect.

Seed Flare.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Seed Flare turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.
Seed Flare.detailed_effect:
Seed Flare deals damage and has a 40% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Seed Flare.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Special Defense two stages.

Seismic Toss.effect: Inflicts damage equal to user's level.
Seismic Toss.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Seismic Toss turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Seismic Toss.detailed_effect: The damage of Seismic Toss is equal to the user's level. So at level 100 the Pokémon will inflict 100 HP damage.
Seismic Toss.secondary_effect: Inflicts damage equal to the user's level.

Self-Destruct.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Self-Destruct turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 200.
Self-Destruct.detailed_effect: Self-Destruct deals high damage, but causes the user to faint.

Shadow Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Ball turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.
Shadow Ball.detailed_effect:
Shadow Ball deals damage and has a 20% chance of lowering the target's Special Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Shadow Ball.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Defense one stage.

Shadow Bone.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Bone turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.
Shadow Bone.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Defense one stage.

Shadow Claw.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Claw turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 140.
Shadow Claw.detailed_effect: Shadow Claw deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Shadow Claw.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Shadow Force.effect: Disappears on first turn, attacks on second. Can strike through Protect/Detect.
Shadow Force.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Force turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 190.
Shadow Force.detailed_effect:
The user of Shadow Force will vanish instantly on the first turn, disappearing from view and becoming invulnerable to most attacks. On the second turn, Shadow Force deals damage and can hit Pokémon using Protect or Detect . It also removes their effect for the rest of the turn (in double and triple battles).

While disappeared, the Pokémon can only be hit by moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move.

If the user is holding a Power Herb , Shadow Force executes in one turn.
Shadow Force.secondary_effect: The user is protected the first turn, Attacks the second turn. Hits through Protect

Shadow Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Punch turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 120.
Shadow Punch.detailed_effect: Shadow Punch deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Shadow Sneak.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shadow Sneak turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 100.
Shadow Sneak.detailed_effect:
Shadow Sneak deals damage and has a priority of +1.

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

Sharpen.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sharpen turns into Z-Sharpen and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sharpen.detailed_effect:
Sharpen raises the user's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Shattered Psyche.detailed_effect: Shattered Psyche is the Psychic type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Shed Tail.effect: Creates a substitute, then swaps places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
Shed Tail.detailed_effect: Creates a substitute, then swaps places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
Shed Tail.secondary_effect: Creates a decoy using 1/4 of the user's maximum HP. Switches out to another Pokémon in the part with the Substitute still out

Sheer Cold.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Icium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sheer Cold turns into Subzero Slammer and has base power 180.
Sheer Cold.detailed_effect:
If it hits, Sheer Cold is guaranteed to make the opponent faint. Its accuracy increases if the user is a higher level than the target Pokémon, but fails if the target is higher level or is Ice type.

Its accuracy (as a percentage) is calculated as below, if the user is Ice type, ignoring all other accuracy and evasion modifiers:

This means that if the user and target Pokémon are the same level, Sheer Cold has 30% accuracy. If the user is not Ice type, its accuracy percentage is:
Sheer Cold.in_depth_effect: This move has its accuracy lowered when used by non-Ice-type Pokémon;, and cannot damage Ice-type Pokémon

Shell Side Arm.effect: May poison opponent. Inflicts either Special or Physical damage, whichever is better.
Shell Side Arm.detailed_effect: May poison opponent. Inflicts either Special or Physical damage, whichever is better.
Shell Side Arm.in_depth_effect: If Shell Side Arm becomes a Physical move, it will make Physical Contact as well.

Shell Smash.effect: Sharply raises user's Attack, Special Attack and Speed but lowers Defense and Special Defense.
Shell Smash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shell Smash turns into Z-Shell Smash and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Shell Smash.detailed_effect:
Shell Smash lowers the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each, while also raising Attack, Special Attack and Speed by two stages each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each, or lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Shell Smash.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Defense & Special Defense by one stage. Increases user's Attack, Special Attack & Speed two stages

Shell Trap.effect: Deals more damage to opponent if hit by a Physical move.
Shell Trap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shell Trap turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 200.
Shell Trap.detailed_effect: Shell Trap sets a trap at the beginning of the turn, and if the user is hit by a physical move during the turn, it deals high damage to the opponent.
Shell Trap.secondary_effect: If user is hit by a physical Attack after using this move, damage is inflicted

Shelter.detailed_effect:
Shelter raises the user's Defense by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Shift Gear.effect: Raises user's Attack and sharply raises Speed.
Shift Gear.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shift Gear turns into Z-Shift Gear and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Shift Gear.detailed_effect:
Shift Gear raises the user's Attack by one stage and Speed by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Shift Gear.secondary_effect: Raises user's Attack one stage. Raises user's Speed two stages.

Shock Wave.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shock Wave turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.
Shock Wave.detailed_effect: Shock Wave deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Shore Up.effect: The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm.
Shore Up.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Shore Up turns into Z-Shore Up and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Shore Up.detailed_effect: The user regains up to half of its max HP. It restores more HP in a sandstorm.
Shore Up.secondary_effect: Heals up to 50% of maximum Hit Points. Heals 66.6% of maximum Hit Points in a Sandstorm

Signal Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Signal Beam turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 140.
Signal Beam.detailed_effect:
Signal Beam deals damage and has a 10% chance of confusing the target.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

Silk Trap.effect: Protects the user and lowers opponent's Speed on contact.
Silk Trap.detailed_effect: Protects the user and lowers opponent's Speed on contact.
Silk Trap.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Silk Trap.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Attack one stage if hit by physical contact. Fails on successive uses

Silver Wind.effect: May raise all stats of user at once.
Silver Wind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Silver Wind turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 120.
Silver Wind.detailed_effect:
Silver Wind deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Attack, Defense, Special Attack, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Simple Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Simple Beam turns into Z-Simple Beam and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Simple Beam.detailed_effect:
Simple Beam changes the target's ability to Simple .

It does not cancel any ability's effects already felt (such as the Attack drop from Intimidate ), but it does stop any further effects the ability may have (for example, damage from Rough Skin ).

It does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Truant or Multitype .
Simple Beam.in_depth_effect: Changes the target's ability to be Simple. This does not work on Pokémon with the abilities Multitype, Stance Change, or Truant.

Sing.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sing turns into Z-Sing and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sing.detailed_effect:
Sing puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

Sinister Arrow Raid.detailed_effect: Sinister Arrow Raid is a Ghost type Z-move exclusive to Decidueye . It is used with Decidueye's signature move Spirit Shackle .

Sizzly Slide.detailed_effect:
Sizzly Slide deals damage and burns the opponent.

Sizzly Slide is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble , Buzzy Buzz , Glitzy Glow , Baddy Bad , Sappy Seed , Freezy Frost , and Sparkly Swirl .

Sketch.effect: Permanently copies the opponent's last move.
Sketch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sketch turns into Z-Sketch and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sketch.detailed_effect: Permanently copies the opponent's last move.
Sketch.secondary_effect: Copies the opponent's last move forever.

Skill Swap.effect: The user swaps Abilities with the opponent.
Skill Swap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Skill Swap turns into Z-Skill Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Skill Swap.detailed_effect: The user swaps Abilities with the opponent.
Skill Swap.in_depth_effect: This move will switch the users ability to the ability of the target Pokémon if that Pokémon does not have the Illusion, Wonder Guard, Stance Change, Multitype, RKS System, Zen Mode, Battle Bond, Comatose, Gulp Missile, DIsguise, Hunger Switch, Neutralizing Gas, Shields Down, Schooling, Power Construct, As One - Unnerve Chilling Neigh, As One - Unnerve Grim Neigh, Zero to Hero, Commander, Hadron Engine, Orichalcum Pulse, Protosynthesis & Quark Drive abilities

Skitter Smack.detailed_effect:
The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also lowers the target’s Sp. Atk stat.

Skitter Smack is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.
Skitter Smack.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Special Attack one stage

Skull Bash.effect: Raises Defense on first turn, attacks on second.
Skull Bash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Skull Bash turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 195.
Skull Bash.detailed_effect:
The user of Skull Bash will tuck in its head on the first turn and raise its Defense by one stage. On the second turn, Skull Bash deals damage.

If the user is holding a Power Herb , Skull Bash executes in one turn.

Sky Attack.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second. May cause flinching. High critical hit ratio.
Sky Attack.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Sky Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Attack turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 200.
Sky Attack.detailed_effect:
The user of Sky Attack will become cloaked in a harsh light on the first turn. On the second turn, Sky Attack deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).. It also has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).

If the user is holding a Power Herb , Sky Attack executes in one turn. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch. Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor , or those under the effects of Lucky Chant , are protected against critical hits.

Sky Drop.effect: Takes opponent into the air on first turn, drops them on second turn.
Sky Drop.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Sky Drop.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Drop turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.
Sky Drop.detailed_effect:
Sky Drop takes the target into the air on the first turn, then drops them on the second turn, wherein they receive damage.

While in the air, neither Pokémon can be hit, except by Gust , Hurricane , Sky Uppercut , Smack Down , Thunder or Twister . Moves from No Guard Pokémon, or any move following an identify move can also hit.

Sky Drop will appear to work on Flying -types and those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis , but will not cause them any damage. It fails if Gravity is in effect, the target is holding an Iron Ball , or is behind a Substitute .

There is a glitch with Sky Drop in Black/White in double battles. If Gravity is put into effect while the Pokémon are in the air, the user of Sky Drop returns to the ground, but the target stays in the air and cannot attack or be hit (besides the moves noted above). Due to this, it was briefly banned from Wi-Fi battles and all official Pokémon competitions.

Sky Uppercut.effect: Hits the opponent, even during Fly.
Sky Uppercut.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sky Uppercut turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.
Sky Uppercut.detailed_effect: Sky Uppercut deals damage and can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Fly or Sky Drop .

Slack Off.effect: User recovers half its max HP.
Slack Off.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Slack Off turns into Z-Slack Off and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Slack Off.detailed_effect: Slack Off recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
Slack Off.secondary_effect: User recovers half the maximum HP.

Slam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Slam turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Slam.detailed_effect: Slam deals damage with no additional effect.

Slash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Slash turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Slash.detailed_effect: Slash deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Slash.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Sleep Powder.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sleep Powder turns into Z-Sleep Powder and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sleep Powder.detailed_effect:
Sleep Powder puts the target to sleep, if it hits. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

Sleep Talk.effect: User performs one of its own moves while sleeping.
Sleep Talk.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sleep Talk turns into Z-Sleep Talk and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sleep Talk.detailed_effect: User performs one of its own moves while sleeping.
Sleep Talk.secondary_effect: Uses an own random move while asleep.

Sludge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sludge turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 120.
Sludge.detailed_effect:
Sludge deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Sludge Bomb.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sludge Bomb turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 175.
Sludge Bomb.detailed_effect:
Sludge Bomb deals damage and has a 30% chance of poisoning the target.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Sludge Wave.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sludge Wave turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 175.
Sludge Wave.detailed_effect:
Sludge Wave deals damage and has a 10% chance of poisoning the target.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Smack Down.effect: Makes Flying-type Pokémon vulnerable to Ground moves.
Smack Down.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smack Down turns into Continental Crush and has base power 100.
Smack Down.detailed_effect:
Smack Down deals damage and knocks the target to the ground. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap . Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Smack Down can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal.
Smack Down.in_depth_effect: In addition to removing Ground-type immunities, this move can also affect Pokémon that have flown up into the air using Fly or Bounce. Doing so cancels the move. It can hit Pokémon using or affected by Sky Drop but doesn't cancel the move.
Smack Down.secondary_effect: Removes target's Ground-type resistance. Damages Pokémon using Fly & Bounce and cancels the move. Damages Pokémon using Sky Drop

Smart Strike.effect: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.
Smart Strike.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smart Strike turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 140.
Smart Strike.detailed_effect: The user stabs the target with a sharp horn. This attack never misses.

Smelling Salts.effect: Power doubles if opponent is paralyzed, but cures it.
Smelling Salts.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smelling Salts turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Smelling Salts.detailed_effect: Smelling Salts deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the target is paralyzed. However, it also cures the paralysis.

Smog.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smog turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 100.
Smog.detailed_effect:
Smog deals damage and has a 40% chance of poisoning the target.

Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Smokescreen.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Smokescreen turns into Z-Smokescreen and raises Evasiveness one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Smokescreen.detailed_effect:
Smokescreen lowers the target's Accuracy by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the abilities Keen Eye , Clear Body or White Smoke cannot have their accuracy reduced.

Snap Trap.effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Snap Trap.detailed_effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns. (100% chance)

Snarl.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Snarl turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 100.
Snarl.detailed_effect:
Snarl deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Snarl.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

Snatch.effect: Steals the effects of the opponent's next move.
Snatch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Snatch turns into Z-Snatch and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Snatch.detailed_effect:
Snatch moves first and steals the effects of the next status move used by the opponent(s) in that turn. If two or more Pokémon use Snatch , the slowest of the Pokémon will gain the effect, because the fastest Pokémon will steal the move first, then the next slowest will steal the move from the snatcher and so on.

Moves that can be snatched:

Moves that cannot be snatched:

Snipe Shot.effect: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves. High critical hit ratio.
Snipe Shot.detailed_effect: Ignores moves and abilities that draw in moves. High critical hit ratio.
Snipe Shot.secondary_effect: Ignores move redirection from abilities and moves. Increased Critical Hit ratio

Snore.effect: Can only be used if asleep. May cause flinching.
Snore.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Snore turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Snore.detailed_effect:
Snore deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved). However, it can only be used while the user is asleep (either from a move like Hypnosis or self-induced via Rest ).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Snore.secondary_effect: Can only be used while asleep.

Snowscape.effect: Raises Defense of Ice types for 5 turns.
Snowscape.detailed_effect: Raises Defense of Ice types for 5 turns.

Soak.effect: Changes the target's type to water.
Soak.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Soak turns into Z-Soak and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Soak.detailed_effect: Soak changes the target's type to Water . It does not work on Pokémon with the ability Multitype .

Soft-Boiled.effect: User recovers half its max HP.
Soft-Boiled.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Soft-Boiled turns into Z-Soft-Boiled and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Soft-Boiled.detailed_effect: Soft-Boiled recovers up to 50% of the user's maximum HP.
Soft-Boiled.secondary_effect: User recovers half the maximum HP.

Solar Beam.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second.
Solar Beam.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Solar Beam turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.
Solar Beam.detailed_effect:
The user of Solar Beam will absorb light on the first turn. On the second turn, Solar Beam deals damage.

During intense sunlight or when holding a Power Herb , Solar Beam executes in one turn. During rain , hail or a sandstorm its power decreases by 50%.
Solar Beam.secondary_effect: Charges for the first turn, damages on the second. If Sunny Day is in effect, the charge and attack is in the same turn.

Solar Blade.effect: Charges on first turn, attacks on second.
Solar Blade.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Solar Blade turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.
Solar Blade.detailed_effect:
The user of Solar Blade will absorb light on the first turn. On the second turn, Solar Blade deals damage.

During intense sunlight or when holding a Power Herb , Solar Blade executes in one turn. During rain , hail or a sandstorm its power decreases by 50%.
Solar Blade.secondary_effect: Charges for the first turn, damages on the second. If Sunny Day is in effect, the charge and attack is in the same turn.

Sonic Boom.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sonic Boom turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
