Sonic Boom.detailed_effect: Sonic Boom always deals 20 HP damage to the target, regardless of typing (although Ghost type Pokémon are still immune). It has no additional effect.

Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike.detailed_effect: Soul-Stealing 7-Star Strike is a Ghost type Z-move exclusive to Marshadow . It is used with Marshadow's signature move Spectral Thief .

Spacial Rend.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spacial Rend turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 180.
Spacial Rend.detailed_effect: Spacial Rend deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Spacial Rend.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Spark.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spark turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.
Spark.detailed_effect:
Spark deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Sparkling Aria.effect: Heals the burns of its target.
Sparkling Aria.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sparkling Aria turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 175.
Sparkling Aria.detailed_effect: Sparkling Aria deals damage, and if the target is burned, heals it.

Sparkly Swirl.effect: Cures all status problems in the party Pokémon.
Sparkly Swirl.detailed_effect:
Sparkly Swirl deals damage and heals all status conditions of the user's party Pokémon (similar to Aromatherapy ).

Sparkly Swirl is an Eevee-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Bouncy Bubble , Buzzy Buzz , Sizzly Slide , Glitzy Glow , Baddy Bad , Sappy Seed , and Freezy Frost .

Spectral Thief.effect: The user hides in the target's shadow, steals the target's stat boosts, and then attacks.
Spectral Thief.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spectral Thief turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 175.
Spectral Thief.detailed_effect: The user hides in the target's shadow, steals the target's stat boosts, and then attacks.
Spectral Thief.in_depth_effect: This move will steal all the boosts in each of the opponent's stats from the target Pokémon before applying the damage. If the user has got an ability that alters stat gain such as Simple or Contrary, then those effects are applied to the gained stat boosts. It does not steal any stat drops from the opponent.
Spectral Thief.secondary_effect: Steals opponent's stat boosts before doing damage

Speed Swap.effect: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.
Speed Swap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Speed Swap turns into Z-Speed Swap and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Speed Swap.detailed_effect: The user exchanges Speed stats with the target.

Spicy Extract.effect: Harshly lowers the opponent's Defense and sharply raises their Attack.
Spicy Extract.detailed_effect: Harshly lowers the opponent's Defense and sharply raises their Attack.
Spicy Extract.secondary_effect: Raises the target's Attack stat by two stages. Lowers the target's Defense by two stages

Spider Web.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spider Web turns into Z-Spider Web and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Spike Cannon.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spike Cannon turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Spike Cannon.detailed_effect:
Spike Cannon hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Spike Cannon is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Spike Cannon to always hit the maximum number of times.

Spikes.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the opposing field.
Spikes.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spikes turns into Z-Spikes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Spikes.detailed_effect:
Spikes lays a trap of thorns around the foe, which hurts Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. It can be used up to three times to inflict more damage on incoming Pokémon, equal to a fraction of the Pokémon's HP as shown in the table.

The move will not cause damage to any raised Pokémon. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Spikes can be cleared from the field by the moves Rapid Spin (around the user) or Defog (around the target).
Spikes.in_depth_effect: The damage taken from Spikes on switching in is determined by the numer of layers placed on the side of the field of the pokemon switching in. 1 Layer: 1/8 of Pokemon's Max HP, 2 Layers: 1/6 of Pokemon's Max HP, 3 or more layers: 1/4 of Pokemon's Max HP. Flying-type Pokemon, Magic Guard or Levitate ability Pokémon, Pokemon under the effect of Magnet Rise, or Pokemon holding an Air Balloon or Heavy Duty Boots item are immune to this effect.
Spikes.secondary_effect: Sets a layer of spikes on the opponent's field that hurt the opponent upon switching in.

Spiky Shield.effect: Protects the user and inflicts damage on contact.
Spiky Shield.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spiky Shield turns into Z-Spiky Shield and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Spiky Shield.detailed_effect:
Spiky Shield prevents any attacks targeted at the user from striking, for the duration of the turn. If a contact move is targeted at the Spiky Shield user on that turn, the attacker receives damage of 1/8 their maximum HP. It has priority +4 so will activate before most other moves.

Contact damage does not stack with the Rocky Helmet item or the Rough Skin or Iron Barbs abilities.

The accuracy of Spiky Shield drops by 1/3 each time it is used consecutively after itself or Protect , Detect , Endure , Wide Guard , Quick Guard , King's Shield , or Baneful Bunker .
Spiky Shield.in_depth_effect: This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Spiky Shield.secondary_effect: Damages by 1/8th Maximum Hit Points if hit by physical contact.

Spirit Break.detailed_effect: Spirit Break deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Spirit Break.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Special Attack one stage

Spirit Shackle.effect: Prevents the opponent from switching out.
Spirit Shackle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spirit Shackle turns into Never-Ending Nightmare and has base power 160.
Spirit Shackle.detailed_effect: Spirit Shackle deals damage and prevents the target from switching out, while the user remains in battle.

Spit Up.effect: Power depends on how many times the user performed Stockpile.
Spit Up.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spit Up turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Spit Up.detailed_effect:
Spit Up deals varying damage depending on how many times the user used Stockpile . The base power is 100, 200 or 300 if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively.

Spit Up also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile .
Spit Up.in_depth_effect: This move has four tiers of damage; This attack doesn't do anything if you don't have a stockpile count, so you have to make sure to Stockpile first. If you use Spit Up after zero Stockpile, the attack fails. If you use Spit Up after 1 Stockpile, the Base Power will be 100. If you use Spit Up after 2 Stockpiles, the Base Power will be 200. If you use Spit Up after 3 Stockpiles, the Base Power will be 300

Spite.effect: The opponent's last move loses 2-5 PP.
Spite.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spite turns into Z-Spite and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Spite.detailed_effect: The opponent's last move loses 2-5 PP.

Splash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Splash turns into Z-Splash and raises Attack three stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.

Splintered Stormshards.detailed_effect:
Splintered Stormshards is a Rock-type Z-Move exclusive to Lycanroc . It is used with Stone Edge .

Splintered Stormshards deals damage and eliminates Terrain effects (i. e. Electric Terrain , Grassy Terrain , Misty Terrain or Psychic Terrain ).

Splishy Splash.detailed_effect:
Splishy Splash deals damage and has a 30% chance to paralyze the target.

Splishy Splash is a Pikachu-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Zippy Zap and Floaty Fall .

Spore.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spore turns into Z-Spore and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Spore.detailed_effect:
Spore puts the target to sleep. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.

Spotlight.effect: The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn.
Spotlight.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Spotlight turns into Z-Spotlight and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Spotlight.detailed_effect: The user shines a spotlight on the target so that only the target will be attacked during the turn.

Springtide Storm.effect: Boosts user's stats in Incarnate Forme, or lowers opponent's stats in Therian Forme.
Springtide Storm.detailed_effect:
Springtide Storm deals damage and has a 30% chance of lowering the target's Attack by one stage. The move targets both opponents in a double battle (each with a 30% chance of lowering Attack).

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Springtide Storm.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Attack one stage.

Stealth Rock.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the opposing field.
Stealth Rock.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stealth Rock turns into Z-Stealth Rock and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Stealth Rock.detailed_effect:
Stealth Rock lays a trap of stones around the foe, which hurts Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. The rocks inflict variable damage — a fraction of the Pokémon's maximum HP, based on its susceptibility to the Rock type, as shown in the table.

For example, a Fighting type switching in would lose 1/16 their maximum HP since Rock is not very effective against it. A Fire/Flying type would lose 1/2 their HP since Rock is super-effective against both Fire and Flying.

Stealth Rock can be cleared from the field by the moves Rapid Spin (around the user) or Defog (around the target).
Stealth Rock.in_depth_effect: The damage taken from Stealth Rock on switching in is determined by the Type(s) of the pokemon switching in, and their effective weakness to rock type moves.  If the Pokemon switching in would take 1/4 damage from rock type moves (i.e. both of it's types resist rock moves), it would lose 1/32 of it's Max HP.  If it would take 1/2 damage (normal resistance), it would lose 1/16 of it's Max HP. If it would take neutral damage, it would lose 1/8 of it's Max HP. If it would take x2 damage (normal weakness), it would lose 1/4 of it's Max HP.  If it would take x4 damage (double weakness), it would lose 1/2 of it's Max HP. Magic Guard ability Pokémon, or Pokemon holding Heavy Duty Boots item are immune to this effect.
Stealth Rock.secondary_effect: Sets rocks that hurt the opponent upon switching.

Steam Eruption.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Steam Eruption turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 185.
Steam Eruption.detailed_effect:
Steam Eruption deals damage and has a 30% chance of burning the target.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Steamroller.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Steamroller turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 120.
Steamroller.detailed_effect:
Steamroller deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

If the target has used Minimize , Steamroller ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

Steel Beam.detailed_effect: Steel Beam deals damage but the user loses 50% of its HP.
Steel Beam.secondary_effect: User loses half their Maximum Hit Points. This effect is ignored by Magic Guard.

Steel Roller.effect: Fails if no Terrain in effect.
Steel Roller.detailed_effect:
The user attacks while destroying the terrain. This move fails when the ground hasn’t turned into a terrain.

Steel Roller is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.

Steel Wing.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Steel Wing turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 140.
Steel Wing.detailed_effect:
Steel Wing deals damage and has a 10% chance of raising the user's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Steel Wing.secondary_effect: May raise user's Defense one stage.

Sticky Web.effect: Lowers opponent's Speed when switching into battle.
Sticky Web.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the opposing field.
Sticky Web.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sticky Web turns into Z-Sticky Web and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sticky Web.detailed_effect:
Sticky Web sets up a sticky net around the opposing team, which lowers the Speed of Pokémon switching into battle by one stage.

Raised Pokémon switching in are not affected. Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .
Sticky Web.secondary_effect: Sets a web that lower the opponent's Speed by one stage upon switching.

Stockpile.effect: Stores energy for use with Spit Up and Swallow.
Stockpile.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stockpile turns into Z-Stockpile and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Stockpile.detailed_effect:
Stockpile raises the user's Defense and Special Defense by one stage each and charges up power for use with companion moves Spit Up or Swallow . Stockpile can be used up to three times before its companion moves, which will attack or recover HP respectively.

The power of Spit Up and HP gained from Swallow varies depending on how many times Stockpile was used. After one of those moves is used, the user loses the Defense and Special Defense boosts.
Stockpile.secondary_effect: User stockpiles power for up to 3 turns. Raises Defense & Special Defense one stage until Stockpile is released.

Stoked Sparksurfer.detailed_effect:
Stoked Sparksurfer is an Electric type Z-Move exclusive to Alolan Raichu . It is used with Thunderbolt .

Stoked Sparksurfer deals damage and paralyzes the target.

Stomp.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stomp turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.
Stomp.detailed_effect:
Stomp deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

If the target has used Minimize , Stomp ignores accuracy and deals double damage.

Stomping Tantrum.effect: Driven by frustration, the user attacks the target. If the user's previous move has failed, the power of this move doubles.
Stomping Tantrum.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stomping Tantrum turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 140.
Stomping Tantrum.detailed_effect: Driven by frustration, the user attacks the target. If the user's previous move has failed, the power of this move doubles.
Stomping Tantrum.secondary_effect: Doubles damage if last move failed

Stone Axe.detailed_effect: Stone Axe deals damage and scatters sharp rocks around the opposing field, like Stealth Rock , which damage opponents switching into battle.
Stone Axe.secondary_effect: Sets rocks that hurt the opponent upon switching.

Stone Edge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stone Edge turns into Continental Crush and has base power 180.
Stone Edge.detailed_effect: Stone Edge deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ).
Stone Edge.secondary_effect: Has an increased Critical Hit ratio

Stored Power.effect: Power increases when user's stats have been raised.
Stored Power.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stored Power turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.
Stored Power.detailed_effect:
Stored Power deals varying damage based on the user's stat increases. It starts at base power 20 and increases by 20 for each net stat boost the user has received, including Evasion and Accuracy. In other words the power is:

For example, if the Pokémon used Dragon Dance and Double Team once each, that is a total of 3 stat increases (+1 Attack, +1 Speed, +1 Evasion) and Stored Power's base power will be 20 × 3 + 20 = 80 .

The maximum it could reach (although impractical) if all stats are fully boosted is 20 × 6 × 7 + 20 = a massive 860 base power. (This does not include other boosts - here the Pokémon would have a +6 Special Attack boost meaning a 4× multiplier, plus STAB for most of the Pokémon that can learn Stored Power .)
Stored Power.in_depth_effect: This attack's power starts off with 20 Base Power but increases by 20 Base Power for each stat increase used by the Pokémon. Can get a maximum Base Power of 860. Moves with stat lowering effects do not affect this move's power.
Stored Power.secondary_effect: Increases damage by 20 Base Points for each stage a stat has been increased by the user

Storm Throw.effect: Always results in a critical hit.
Storm Throw.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Storm Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.
Storm Throw.detailed_effect:
Storm Throw deals damage and always results in a critical hit, increasing its power to 90 .

However, Pokémon with the abilities Battle Armor or Shell Armor , or those under the effect of Lucky Chant are immune to critical hits so Storm Throw will hit them with base power 60.

Strength.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Strength turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Strength.detailed_effect: Strength deals damage with no additional effect in battle.

Strength Sap.effect: The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target's Attack stat. It also lowers the target's Attack stat.
Strength Sap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Strength Sap turns into Z-Strength Sap and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Strength Sap.detailed_effect: The user restores its HP by the same amount as the target's Attack stat. It also lowers the target's Attack stat. (100% chance)
Strength Sap.secondary_effect: Heals user of Hit Points equal to target's Attack stat. Lowers target's Attack by 1 stage

String Shot.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, String Shot turns into Z-String Shot and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
String Shot.detailed_effect:
String Shot lowers the target's Speed by two stages.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Struggle.effect: Only usable when all PP are gone. Hurts the user.
Struggle.targets: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.
Struggle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Struggle turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 1.
Struggle.detailed_effect: Only usable when all PP are gone. Hurts the user.
Struggle.secondary_effect: Damages user equal to 25% of maximum Hit Points

Struggle Bug.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Struggle Bug turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.
Struggle Bug.detailed_effect:
Struggle Bug deals damage and lowers the target's Special Attack by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Struggle Bug.secondary_effect: May lower opponent's Special Attack one stage.

Stuff Cheeks.effect: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat.
Stuff Cheeks.detailed_effect: The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat. (100% chance)

Stun Spore.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Stun Spore turns into Z-Stun Spore and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Stun Spore.detailed_effect:
Stun Spore paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6 ).

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Submission.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Submission turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 160.
Submission.detailed_effect: Submission deals damage, but the user receives 1/4 of the damage it inflicts in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.

Substitute.effect: Uses HP to creates a decoy that takes hits.
Substitute.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Substitute turns into Z-Substitute and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Substitute.detailed_effect: Uses HP to creates a decoy that takes hits.

in_depth_effect.text: This move creates a Substitute on the field using 1/4 of its maximum Hit Points. This substitute has as much HP as was used to create it. The substitute will receive all damage from attacks targeting the user until its Hit Points are depleted. There are several moves that bypass the substitute, listed below.

Substitute.secondary_effect: Creates a decoy using 1/4 of the user's maximum HP.

Subzero Slammer.detailed_effect: Subzero Slammer is the Ice type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Sucker Punch.effect: User attacks first, but only works if opponent is readying an attack.
Sucker Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sucker Punch turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 140.
Sucker Punch.detailed_effect:
Sucker Punch deals damage and has a priority of +1. However, the move only works if the target uses a direct attack in the same turn. If the target is not preparing an attack, Sucker Punch will fail.

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.
Sucker Punch.secondary_effect: Damages the opponent only if they are intending to use a damaging move. Fails if used after the opponent moves.

Sunny Day.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sunny Day turns into Z-Sunny Day and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sunny Day.detailed_effect: Sunny Day causes bright sunlight that lasts for 5 turns, and induces these additional effects:

Sunsteel Strike.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Steelium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sunsteel Strike turns into Corkscrew Crash and has base power 180.

Super Fang.effect: Always takes off half of the opponent's HP.
Super Fang.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Super Fang turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Super Fang.detailed_effect: Always takes off half of the opponent's HP.
Super Fang.secondary_effect: Cuts the opponent's Hit Points by 50% of the current value

Supercell Slam.detailed_effect: The user electrifies its body and drops onto the target to inflict damage. If this move misses, the user takes damage instead.

Superpower.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Superpower turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 190.
Superpower.detailed_effect:
Superpower deals damage but lowers the user's Attack and Defense by one stage each after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Superpower.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Attack and Defense one stage.

Supersonic.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Supersonic turns into Z-Supersonic and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Supersonic.detailed_effect:
Supersonic causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused. Soundproof also prevents this move.

Supersonic Skystrike.detailed_effect: Supersonic Skystrike is the Flying type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Surf.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Surf turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 175.
Surf.detailed_effect:
Surf deals damage. In double battles it will hit all Pokémon on the field; in triple battles it will hit all adjacent Pokémon.

If the opponent is hidden underwater from using Dive , Surf will hit with double power.

Surging Strikes.effect: Always results in a critical hit and ignores stat changes.
Surging Strikes.detailed_effect: Always results in a critical hit and ignores stat changes.

Swagger.effect: Confuses opponent, but sharply raises its Attack.
Swagger.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swagger turns into Z-Swagger and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Swagger.detailed_effect:
Swagger confuses the target and raises its Attack by two stages.

If one of the two effects cannot be invoked (for example the target is already confused or its Attack is already raised to the maximum of +6 stages), Swagger still works and will invoke the other effect.

Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.
Swagger.secondary_effect: Induces Confusion. Raises opponent's Attack two stages.

Swallow.effect: The more times the user has performed Stockpile, the more HP is recovered.
Swallow.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swallow turns into Z-Swallow and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Swallow.detailed_effect:
Swallow recovers a varying amount of HP depending on how many times the user has used Stockpile . It recovers 25%, 50% or 100% of the user's maximum HP if the user stockpiled one, two or three times respectively.

Swallow also removes the Defense and Special Defense boosts given through Stockpile .
Swallow.in_depth_effect: This move has four tiers of healing; This attack doesn't do anything if you don't have a stockpile count, so you have to make sure to Stockpile first. If you use Swallow after zero Stockpile, the attack fails. If you use Swallow after 1 Stockpile, you will recover 1/4 of your Max HP. If you use Swallow after 2 Stockpiles, you will recover 1/2 of your Max HP. If you use Swallow after 3 Stockpiles, you will recover all of your Max HP
Swallow.secondary_effect: Absorbs power from STOCKPILE and recovers HP.

Sweet Kiss.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fairium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sweet Kiss turns into Z-Sweet Kiss and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sweet Kiss.detailed_effect:
Sweet Kiss causes the target to become confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

Sweet Scent.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Sweet Scent turns into Z-Sweet Scent and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Sweet Scent.detailed_effect:
Sweet Scent lowers the target's Evasion by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Swift.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swift turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 120.
Swift.detailed_effect: Swift deals damage and ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Switcheroo.effect: Swaps held items with the opponent.
Switcheroo.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Switcheroo turns into Z-Switcheroo and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Switcheroo.detailed_effect:
Switcheroo switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it.

Switching items with wild Pokémon is permanent (received items are kept, given items are lost). All held items in Trainer battles and wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina ; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus ; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect ; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.

Swords Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Swords Dance turns into Z-Swords Dance and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Swords Dance.detailed_effect:
Swords Dance raises the user's Attack by two stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Synchronoise.effect: Hits any Pokémon that shares a type with the user.
Synchronoise.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Synchronoise turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 190.
Synchronoise.detailed_effect: Synchronoise hits all adjacent Pokémon that share a type with the user. Dual type Pokémon match either of their types, so for example a Normal/Flying Pokémon using Synchronoise will hit a Flying/Dragon type.

Synthesis.effect: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.
Synthesis.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Synthesis turns into Z-Synthesis and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Synthesis.detailed_effect: User recovers HP. Amount varies with the weather.
Synthesis.in_depth_effect: This move recovers its HP depending upon the weather. If no weather is in effect, it heals the user by 50% of their maximum Hit Points. If Sunny Day is in effect, this move heals the user by 66.66% of its maximum Hit Points and if Rain Dance, Hail or Sandstorm is in effect, this move heals the user by 25% of their maximum Hit Points

Syrup Bomb.effect: Lowers opponent's Speed each turn for 3 turns.
Syrup Bomb.detailed_effect: Lowers opponent's Speed each turn for 3 turns.
Syrup Bomb.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Speed every turn for three tuirns

Tachyon Cutter.effect: Guaranteed to hit twice in a row.
Tachyon Cutter.detailed_effect: Guaranteed to hit twice in a row.

Tackle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tackle turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Tackle.detailed_effect: Tackle is one of the most common and basic moves a Pokémon learns. It deals damage with no additional effects.

Tail Glow.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Glow turns into Z-Tail Glow and eliminates any stat drops applied to the user, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Tail Glow.detailed_effect:
Tail Glow raises the user's Special Attack by three stages.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each. Assuming no other stat changes, the first use of Tail Glow would raise Special Attack to 2. 5× normal value, and the second to 4× (the maximum level).
Tail Glow.secondary_effect: Raises user's Special Attack three stages.

Tail Slap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Slap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 140.
Tail Slap.detailed_effect:
Tail Slap hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Tail Slap is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Tail Slap to always hit the maximum number of times.
Tail Slap.secondary_effect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hits

Tail Whip.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tail Whip turns into Z-Tail Whip and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Tail Whip.detailed_effect:
Tail Whip lowers the target's Defense by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Tailwind.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Tailwind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tailwind turns into Z-Tailwind and raises critical-hit ratio one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Tailwind.detailed_effect: Tailwind doubles the speed of all Pokémon in the user's party for 4 turns.
Tailwind.secondary_effect: Increases Speed of all user's Pokémon for four turns by two stages.

Take Down.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Take Down turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
Take Down.detailed_effect: Take Down deals damage, but the user receives 1/4 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
Take Down.secondary_effect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

Take Heart.effect: Heals user's status conditions and raises its stats.
Take Heart.detailed_effect:
Take Heart heals the user's status conditions, and raises the user's Special Attack and Special Defense by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Take Heart.secondary_effect: Raises the user's Sp. Attack and Special Defense by one stage

Tar Shot.effect: Lowers the opponent's Speed and makes them weaker to Fire-type moves.
Tar Shot.detailed_effect: Lowers the opponent's Speed and makes them weaker to Fire-type moves. (100% chance)
Tar Shot.in_depth_effect: This move makes it so the user now has an increased Fire weakness.
Tar Shot.secondary_effect: Lowers target's Speed stat by 1 stage. Target receives more damage from Fire-type moves

Taunt.effect: Opponent can only use moves that attack.
Taunt.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Taunt turns into Z-Taunt and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Taunt.detailed_effect: Taunt prevents the target from using Status-category moves for three turns.
Taunt.secondary_effect: The opponent can only use damaging moves for three turns

Tearful Look.effect: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats.
Tearful Look.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tearful Look turns into Z-Tearful Look and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Tearful Look.detailed_effect: The user gets teary eyed to make the target lose its combative spirit. This lowers the target's Attack and Sp. Atk stats. (100% chance)
Tearful Look.secondary_effect: Lowers target's Attack & Special Attack stats by 1 stage

Teatime.effect: Forces all Pokémon on the field to eat their berries.
Teatime.detailed_effect: Forces all Pokémon on the field to eat their berries.
Teatime.secondary_effect: Causes all PokÃ©mon to activate their Berry

Techno Blast.effect: Type depends on the Drive being held.
Techno Blast.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Techno Blast turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.
Techno Blast.detailed_effect:
Techno Blast deals damage. Its type changes depending on the held Drive:

Techno Blast is the signature move of Genesect.
Techno Blast.secondary_effect: Changes the type of the move based upon the item being held

Tectonic Rage.detailed_effect: Tectonic Rage is the Ground type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Teeter Dance.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Teeter Dance turns into Z-Teeter Dance and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Teeter Dance.detailed_effect:
Teeter Dance causes all adjacent Pokémon to become confused. In single battles this is simply the opponent; in double/triple battles it includes all adjacent opponents and teammate(s).

Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Teeter Dance.secondary_effect: Confuses all Pokémon on the field.

Telekinesis.effect: Ignores opponent's Evasiveness for three turns, add Ground immunity.
Telekinesis.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Telekinesis turns into Z-Telekinesis and raises Special Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Telekinesis.detailed_effect:
Telekinesis raises the target into the air for three turns, guaranteeing that all attacks against the target (except OHKO moves) will hit, regardless of Accuracy or Evasion.

The target gains the usual benefits of being raised , e. g. immunity to Ground -type moves.

The effect is cancelled if the raised Pokémon is hit by Smack Down .

Teleport.effect: Allows user to flee wild battles; also warps player to last PokéCenter.
Teleport.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Teleport turns into Z-Teleport and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Teleport.detailed_effect: In Pokémon Let's Go Pikachu/Eevee and Pokémon Sword/Shield, Teleport switches the user out.
Teleport.in_depth_effect: This attack allows for the user to retreat from battle and let you select a new Pokémon to place into combat.

Temper Flare.detailed_effect: Spurred by desperation, the user attacks the target. This move’s power is doubled if the user’s previous move failed.
Temper Flare.secondary_effect: Doubles damage if last move failed

Tera Blast.effect: Changes type when the user has Terastallized.
Tera Blast.detailed_effect:
Tera Blast deals damage, and its type changes to the user's Tera Type, when the Pokémon is Terastallized.

Tera Blast uses the Pokémon's Attack or Special Attack stat, whichever is higher.
Tera Blast.secondary_effect: Changes type if the user is Terastallized. Damage inflicted depends on user's Attack or Special Attack. Highest stat used to determine if move is Physical or Special.

Tera Starstorm.detailed_effect: With the power of its crystals, the user bombards and eliminates the target. When used by Terapagos in its Stellar Form, this move damages all opposing Pokémon.
Tera Starstorm.secondary_effect: Damage inflicted depends on user's Attack or Special Attack. Highest stat used to determine if move is Physical or Special.

Terrain Pulse.effect: Type and power change depending on the Terrain in effect.
Terrain Pulse.detailed_effect:
The user utilizes the power of the terrain to attack. This move’s type and power changes depending on the terrain when it’s used.

Terrain Pulse is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.
Terrain Pulse.secondary_effect: Becomes the type of Terrain and doubles in power

Thief.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thief turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 120.
Thief.detailed_effect:
Thief deals damage and steals the target's held item, if the user is not holding an item.

Items stolen from wild Pokémon are kept after the battle ends, but items stolen from a Trainer's Pokémon are not. Items stolen from the player's Pokémon either by wild Pokémon or Trainer Pokémon are returned at the end of the battle. All held items in wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.

If the item would activate on attack (e. g. Focus Band ), it does so before being stolen. If the item is consumable on attack (e. g. Focus Sash ) then the item is consumed as normal and cannot be stolen.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina ; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus ; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect ; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.
Thief.secondary_effect: May steal opponent's item (temporarily in trainer battles).

Thousand Arrows.effect: Makes Flying-type Pokémon vulnerable to Ground moves.
Thousand Arrows.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thousand Arrows turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 180.
Thousand Arrows.detailed_effect:
Thousand Arrows deals damage and knocks the target(s) to the ground. Any raised Pokémon now become susceptible to Ground moves and Arena Trap . Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Thousand Arrows can hit Pokémon using Fly or Bounce and will bring them back down to the ground, thus cancelling the moves. It can also hit Pokémon using Sky Drop but does not knock them to the ground. It does not knock down Substitutes but deals damage to the Substitute as normal.
Thousand Arrows.secondary_effect: Ignores Ground-type Resistance. Knocks Flying/Levitating Pokémon to the ground.

Thousand Waves.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Groundium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thousand Waves turns into Tectonic Rage and has base power 175.
Thousand Waves.detailed_effect: Thousand Waves deals damage and prevents the target(s) from fleeing or switching out, as long as the user remains in battle.

Thrash.effect: User attacks for 2-3 turns but then becomes confused.
Thrash.targets: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.
Thrash.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thrash turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.
Thrash.detailed_effect:
The user of Thrash attacks for 2-3 turns, during which it cannot switch out, and then becomes confused. Confused Pokémon have a 33% chance of hurting themselves each turn, for 1-4 attacking turns (50% chance in Generations 1-6 ). The damage received is as if the Pokémon attacks itself with a typeless 40 base power Physical attack.

If Thrash is disrupted (e. g. if the move misses or the user cannot attack due to paralysis) then it will stop and not cause confusion.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.
Thrash.secondary_effect: User uses the same Attack for 2-3 turns then becomes confused.

structuredEffects.note: Guaranteed after 2-3 turns of attacking

Throat Chop.effect: Prevents use of sound moves for two turns.
Throat Chop.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Throat Chop turns into Black Hole Eclipse and has base power 160.
Throat Chop.detailed_effect: Throat Chop deals damage and prevents the target from using sound-based moves such as Hyper Voice for two turns.
Throat Chop.secondary_effect: Prevents target from using Sound moves for 2 turns

Thunder.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 185.
Thunder.detailed_effect:
Thunder deals damage and has a 30% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

If used during rain , Thunder ignores accuracy. Conversely, if used during intense sunlight , its accuracy drops to 50%.

Thunder can hit Pokémon during the first stage of Bounce , Fly or Sky Drop .
Thunder.in_depth_effect: This move has different accuracies depending upon the weather. In Rain, it has an accuracy of 100%. In Sunshine, it has an accuracy of 50%. In all other weather states, it has an accuracy of 70%.
Thunder.secondary_effect: May induce Paralysis. Damages Pokémon using Fly, Bounce or Sky Drop

Thunder Cage.effect: Deals damage and traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Thunder Cage.detailed_effect: Deals damage and traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Thunder Cage.secondary_effect: Traps the opponent for 4 to 5 turns

Thunder Fang.effect: May cause flinching and/or paralyze opponent.
Thunder Fang.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Fang turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 120.
Thunder Fang.detailed_effect:
Thunder Fang deals damage, has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target, and has a 10% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Thunder Fang.secondary_effect: May PARALYZE opponent or cause opponent to flinch.

Thunder Punch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Punch turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 140.
Thunder Punch.detailed_effect:
Thunder Punch deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Thunder Shock.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Shock turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 100.
Thunder Shock.detailed_effect:
Thunder Shock deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Thunder Wave.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunder Wave turns into Z-Thunder Wave and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Thunder Wave.detailed_effect:
Thunder Wave paralyzes the opponent. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6 ).

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Thunderbolt.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Thunderbolt turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 175.
Thunderbolt.detailed_effect:
Thunderbolt deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target.

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Thunderclap.secondary_effect: Damages the opponent only if they are intending to use a damaging move. Fails if used after the opponent moves.

Tickle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tickle turns into Z-Tickle and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Tickle.detailed_effect:
Tickle lowers the target's Attack and Defense by one stage each.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Tickle.secondary_effect: Lowers opponent's Attack and Defense one stage.

Tidy Up.effect: Removes the effects of entry hazards and Substitute, and boosts user’s Attack and Speed.
Tidy Up.detailed_effect: Removes the effects of entry hazards and Substitute, and boosts user’s Attack and Speed.
Tidy Up.secondary_effect: User removes trapping moves. Increased Attack and Speed by 1 stage.

Topsy-Turvy.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Topsy-Turvy turns into Z-Topsy-Turvy and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Topsy-Turvy.detailed_effect:
Topsy-Turvy reverses the stat changes of the target Pokémon.

For example, if the target has boosted their attack by 2 stages using Swords Dance , Topsy-Turvy will reduce their Attack down to -2 stages. Similarly, if the opponent has used Draco Meteor (lowering their Special Attack), Topsy-Turvy will raise their Special Attack to +2 stages.
Topsy-Turvy.secondary_effect: Inverts all stat alterations on the target.

Torch Song.secondary_effect: Raises user's Special Attack one stage

Torment.effect: Opponent cannot use the same move in a row.
Torment.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Darkinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Torment turns into Z-Torment and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Torment.detailed_effect: Opponent cannot use the same move in a row.
Torment.secondary_effect: Opponent cannot use the same move in a row.

Toxic.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic turns into Z-Toxic and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Toxic.detailed_effect:
Toxic causes the target to be badly poisoned. Pokémon that are badly poisoned will lose an increasing amount of HP at the end of each turn.

The affected Pokémon will lose 1/16 of its maximum HP at the end of the first turn, which then increases by 1/16 each turn. In other words, they lose 1/16 , 1/8 , 3/16 , 1/4 and so on.

If used by a Poison-type Pokémon, Toxic will always hit, even if the target is in the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Toxic doesn't affect Pokémon already carrying a major status ailment, Pokémon behind a Substitute nor Poison - or Steel -type Pokémon.

Toxic Spikes.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the opposing field.
Toxic Spikes.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic Spikes turns into Z-Toxic Spikes and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Toxic Spikes.detailed_effect:
Toxic Spikes lays a trap of poisonous spikes around the foe, which poison Pokémon switching in to the opposing field. If used more than once, incoming Pokémon will be badly poisoned.

The spikes will not poison any raised Pokémon, nor does it affect Poison or Steel types, nor Pokémon with the abilities Immunity or Magic Guard . Raised Pokémon are any Flying types or those under the effects of Levitate , Magnet Rise or Telekinesis .

Toxic Spikes can be cleared from the field by the moves Rapid Spin (around the user) or Defog (around the target). Poison type Pokémon (that are not raised) will absorb the spikes upon switching in, removing their effect.
Toxic Spikes.in_depth_effect: Toxic Spikes applies the Poisoned or Toxic Poisoned status to Pokemon switching in dependent on the numer of layers placed on the side of the field of the pokemon switching in. 1 Layer: applies Poison, 2+ Layers: applies Toxic Poison. Flying, Poison, or Steel-type Pokemon, Magic Guard, Levitate, Immunity or Comatose ability Pokémon, Leaf Guard ability Pokemon in Sun weather, Pokemon under the effect of Magnet Rise, or Pokemon holding an Air Balloon or Heavy Duty Boots item are immune to this effect.  If a Poison-type Pokemon switches in, it will remove all layers of Toxic Spikes from that Pokemon's side of the field.
Toxic Spikes.secondary_effect: Sets spikes that POISON the opponent upon switching.

Toxic Thread.effect: Poisons opponent and lowers its Speed.
Toxic Thread.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Toxic Thread turns into Z-Toxic Thread and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Toxic Thread.detailed_effect:
Toxic Thread poisons the target, and lowers its Speed by one stage.

Each effect still occurs if the other cannot, for example a Poison type Pokémon will still have its Speed reduced. Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
Toxic Thread.secondary_effect: Inflicts Poison. Lowers opponent's Speed by 1 stage.

Trailblaze.detailed_effect: Trailblaze deals damage and raises the user's speed by one stage.

Transform.effect: User takes on the form and attacks of the opponent.
Transform.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Transform turns into Z-Transform and fully restores the user's HP, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Transform.detailed_effect: User takes on the form and attacks of the opponent.
Transform.in_depth_effect: Transform will have the user temporarily mimic the target. The user will copy the following from the target: The User will temporarily become the target species, overriding all of user's stats with the target's calculated stats, including copying stat stage increases/decreases. The user will also copy all of the target's moves, temporarily replacing it's own moveset with that of the target's. The user essentially becomes the other Pokémon for the duration of being transformed. However, when the transformed user lands a Critical Hit, the damage done will be based on it's non-transformed stats (meaning it's possible for a critical hit to do less damage than a non-critical hit).

Tri Attack.effect: May paralyze, burn or freeze opponent.

structuredEffects.note: 33% chance if this branch is selected (shared with burn and freeze)
33% chance if this branch is selected (shared with paralysis and freeze)
33% chance if this branch is selected (shared with paralysis and burn)

Tri Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Tri Attack turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Tri Attack.detailed_effect:
Tri Attack deals damage and has a 20% chance of paralyzing, burning or freezing the target - i. e. a 6. 67% chance of each status condition.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned. Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed. Ice type Pokémon, those with the ability Magma Armor or those behind a Substitute cannot be frozen.
Tri Attack.secondary_effect: May induce burn, freeze or paralysis.

Trick.effect: Swaps held items with the opponent.
Trick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick turns into Z-Trick and raises Speed two stages, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Trick.detailed_effect:
Trick switches held items with the target. It does not require both Pokémon to be holding an item, in which case the item is simply given to the target or received from it.

Switching items with wild Pokémon is permanent (received items are kept, given items are lost). All held items in Trainer battles and wi-fi/linked battles (including Battle Tower/Subway/Maison) are returned to their respective owners at the end of a battle.

Pokemon with the ability Sticky Hold cannot have their held item removed. The Griseous Orb cannot be removed from Giratina ; Type Plates cannot be removed from Arceus ; Drives cannot be removed from Genesect ; and Mega Stones cannot be removed from their respective Pokémon.

Trick Room.effect: Slower Pokémon move first in the turn for 5 turns.
Trick Room.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick Room turns into Z-Trick Room and raises Accuracy one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Trick Room.detailed_effect: Slower Pokémon move first in the turn for 5 turns.
Trick Room.secondary_effect: Inverts the turn order in each Speed Priority bracket for 5 turns.

Trick-or-Treat.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Ghostium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trick-or-Treat turns into Z-Trick-or-Treat and raises all stats one stage each, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Trick-or-Treat.detailed_effect:
Trick-or-Treat adds the Ghost type to the target. If the target is dual-typed they essentially become a triple-typed Pokémon.

It fails if one of the Pokémon's types is already Ghost. If the target is under the effect of Forest's Curse the Grass type is replaced by Ghost.

Triple Arrows.effect: High critical hit ratio. May lower opponent's Defense or cause them to flinch.
Triple Arrows.detailed_effect:
Triple Arrows deals damage and has an increased critical hit ratio ( 1/8 instead of 1/24 ). It has a 50% chance of lowering the target's Defense by one stage, and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each. Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.
Triple Arrows.secondary_effect: May lower target's Defense one stage. May cause opponent to flinch

Triple Axel.effect: Attacks thrice with more power each time.
Triple Axel.detailed_effect:
A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit.

Triple Axel is a tutor move available in The Isle of Armor DLC.
Triple Axel.secondary_effect: Base Power is 20 on the first hit, 40 on the second and 60 on the third

Triple Kick.effect: Hits thrice in one turn at increasing power.
Triple Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Triple Kick turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 120.
Triple Kick.detailed_effect:
Triple Kick deals damage and will strike three times, with each kick's base power increasing by 10. In other words the blows will be base power 10, 20 and 30 - a total of 60 .

Each hit has its own accuracy check, and if one kick misses, the move ends. Therefore, the chances of it being successful for each number of hits (with normal Accuracy/Evasion) are 90%, 81% and 73% respectively.

Each strike of Triple Kick is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

Trop Kick.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trop Kick turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 140.
Trop Kick.detailed_effect:
Trop Kick deals damage and lowers the target's Attack by one stage.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.

Trump Card.effect: The lower the PP, the higher the power.
Trump Card.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Trump Card turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Trump Card.detailed_effect:
Trump Card inflicts more damage when fewer PP are left, as per the table. The power is calculated based on the PP remaining after the move has been used; this is to account for the ability Pressure which deducts 2 PP for each move.

If Trump Card is selected via a different move such as Metronome or Sleep Talk , it uses the PP of that move to determine the power.

Twineedle.effect: Hits twice in one turn. May poison opponent.
Twineedle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, Twineedle turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 100.
Twineedle.detailed_effect:
Twineedle deals damage and will strike twice (with 25 base power each time). It has a 20% chance of poisoning the target. Poison or Steel type Pokémon, those with the ability Immunity or those behind a Substitute cannot be poisoned.

Each strike of Twineedle is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

Twinkle Tackle.detailed_effect: Twinkle Tackle is the Fairy type Z-Move, introduced in Pokémon Sun/Moon.

Twister.effect: May cause flinching. Hits Pokémon using Fly/Bounce with double power.
Twister.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Dragonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Twister turns into Devastating Drake and has base power 100.
Twister.detailed_effect:
Twister deals damage and has a 30% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Twister can hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stages of Bounce , Fly and Sky Drop - and in the case of Bounce and Fly , inflicts double damage.
Twister.secondary_effect: May cause opponent to flinch. Damage is doubled if opponent is using Fly.

U-turn.effect: User switches out immediately after attacking.
U-turn.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, U-turn turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 140.
U-turn.detailed_effect: User switches out immediately after attacking.

Upper Hand.effect: Strikes before a target's priority move.
Upper Hand.detailed_effect: Strikes before a target's priority move.

structuredEffects.note: Only if target chose a positive priority move less than +3 or targets a +3 priority move and user is faster

Uproar.effect: User attacks for 3 turns and prevents sleep.
Uproar.targets: Targets the user, but hits a random adjacent opponent.
Uproar.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Uproar turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 175.
Uproar.detailed_effect: Uproar inflicts damage for 3 turns. During this time, no Pokémon on the field will be able to sleep, and any sleeping Pokémon will be woken up.
Uproar.secondary_effect: Hits for 3 turns. No Pokémon can be Asleep during that time.

V-create.effect: Lowers user's Defense, Special Defense and Speed.
V-create.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, V-create turns into Inferno Overdrive and has base power 220.
V-create.detailed_effect:
V-create deals damage but lowers the user's Defense, Special Defense and Speed by one stage each after attacking.

Stats can be lowered to a minimum of -6 stages each.
V-create.secondary_effect: Lowers user's Defense, Special Defense & Speed one stage.

Vacuum Wave.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vacuum Wave turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 100.
Vacuum Wave.detailed_effect:
Vacuum Wave deals damage and has a priority of +1.

Moves with a higher priority always go first, regardless of a Pokémon's speed. If two moves with the same priority are used, the faster Pokémon goes first as usual.

Veevee Volley.effect: Power increases when player's bond is stronger.
Veevee Volley.detailed_effect:
Veevee Volley is an Eevee-exclusive Partner Power from Pokémon Let's Go. The power increases when Eevee's Friendship is higher (similar to Return ), up to a maximum base power of 102 .

When a different Pokémon is in battle, Veevee Volley may be used to boost that Pokémon's stats.

Venom Drench.effect: Lowers poisoned opponent's Special Attack and Speed.
Venom Drench.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Venom Drench turns into Z-Venom Drench and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Venom Drench.detailed_effect: If the target is poisoned, Venom Drench lowers its Attack, Special Attack and Speed by one stage each.

Venoshock.effect: Inflicts double damage if the target is poisoned.
Venoshock.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Poisonium Z and uses its Z-Power, Venoshock turns into Acid Downpour and has base power 120.
Venoshock.detailed_effect: Inflicts double damage if the target is poisoned.
Venoshock.secondary_effect: Doubles damage inflicted if target is Poisoned

Victory Dance.detailed_effect:
Victory Dance raises the user's Attack, Defense and Speed by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Victory Dance.secondary_effect: Raises the user's Attack, Speed and Defense stats one stage

Vine Whip.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vine Whip turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 100.
Vine Whip.detailed_effect: Vine Whip deals damage with no additional effect.

Vise Grip.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vise Grip turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Vise Grip.detailed_effect: Vise Grip deals damage with no additional effect.

Vital Throw.effect: User attacks last, but ignores Accuracy and Evasiveness.
Vital Throw.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Vital Throw turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.
Vital Throw.detailed_effect: Vital Throw deals damage with lower priority, so most attacks will take place before it. Vital Throw ignores changes to the Accuracy and Evasion stats. However, it will not hit Pokémon during the invulnerable stage of Bounce , Dig , Dive , Fly , Phantom Force , Shadow Force or Sky Drop .

Volt Switch.effect: User must switch out after attacking.
Volt Switch.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Switch turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 140.
Volt Switch.detailed_effect: User must switch out after attacking.

Volt Tackle.effect: User receives recoil damage. May paralyze opponent.
Volt Tackle.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Volt Tackle turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 190.
Volt Tackle.detailed_effect: Volt Tackle deals damage and has a 10% chance of paralyzing the target, but the user receives 1/3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
Volt Tackle.secondary_effect: User receives 1/3rd of damage in re-coil. May PARALYZE opponent.

Wake-Up Slap.effect: Power doubles if opponent is asleep, but wakes it up.
Wake-Up Slap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Fightinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wake-Up Slap turns into All-Out Pummeling and has base power 140.
Wake-Up Slap.detailed_effect: Wake-Up Slap deals damage, and hits with double power (140) if the target is asleep. However, it also wakes up the target.

Water Gun.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Gun turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.
Water Gun.detailed_effect: Water Gun deals damage with no additional effect.

Water Pledge.effect: Added effects appear if preceded by Fire Pledge or succeeded by Grass Pledge.
Water Pledge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Pledge turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
Water Pledge.detailed_effect:
Water Pledge deals damage at base power 80 . If a teammate uses Grass Pledge or Fire Pledge in the same turn, the moves combine into one attack of base power 160 and added effects appear.

The faster Pokémon moves first but waits for the other Pokémon to make their move . When the slower Pledge user moves, the combo attack hits the Pokémon the slower user was targeting.

If Water Pledge is used with Grass Pledge , the move animation shows Grass Pledge and a swamp envelops the foe's team that halves the opponents' speed for 4 turns.

If Water Pledge is used with Fire Pledge , the move animation shows Water Pledge and a rainbow appears in the sky on your team's side that doubles the chance of moves' secondary effects occurring for 4 turns.
Water Pledge.in_depth_effect: This move, if used in Double Battles with Fire Pledge, will create a rainbow which doubles the changes of moves having Seconday Effects for four turns. The power is increased to 150 This move, if used in Double Battles with Grass Pledge, will create a marsh which reduces the speed of all opponents by 75% for four turns. The power is increased to 150
Water Pledge.secondary_effect: If combined with Fire Oath, increases likelihood of Secondary Effects by 30% for four turns.

Water Pulse.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Water Pulse.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Pulse turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 120.
Water Pulse.detailed_effect:
Water Pulse deals damage and has a 20% chance of confusing the target.

Pokémon with the ability Own Tempo or those behind a Substitute cannot be confused.

Water Shuriken.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Shuriken turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.
Water Shuriken.detailed_effect:
Water Shuriken attacks with increased priority.

Water Shuriken hits 2-5 times per turn used. The probability of each interval is shown in the table, with the total power after each hit.

Each strike of Water Shuriken is treated like a separate attack:

The move Counter only counters the final hit, but Bide counters the complete damage.

The Skill Link ability will cause Water Shuriken to always hit the maximum number of times.

If Battle Bond is active, Water Shuriken always hits 3 times, each with 20 base power.
Water Shuriken.secondary_effect: Attacks 2-5 times in a row. 37.5% chance of 2 hits. 37.5% chance of 3 hits. 12.5% chance of 4 hits. 12.5% chance of 5 hitsBase Power increased to 20 if Battle Bond has activated and will hit 3 times guaranteed.

Water Sport.effect: Weakens the power of Fire-type moves.
Water Sport.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Sport turns into Z-Water Sport and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Water Sport.detailed_effect:
Water Sport reduces the power of Fire -type moves by 50%. The effect applies to the entire field.

Most Pokémon that learn Water Sport are part Water type and thus already resistant to Fire attacks.

Water Spout.effect: The higher the user's HP, the higher the damage caused.
Water Spout.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Water Spout turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 200.
Water Spout.detailed_effect:
Water Spout inflicts more damage when the user's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 150 and it decreases in proportion - i. e. the power is:

Water Spout is a counterpart move to Eruption . It is also similar to Crush Grip and Wring Out , based on the user rather than the opponent.
Water Spout.in_depth_effect: This attack has a Base Power of 150 but is dependent on the User's HP. The base power is calculated by the following formula: Base Power = (User's Current HP * 150) / (User's Max HP). This gives it a maximum power of 150 and a Minimum of 1.
Water Spout.secondary_effect: Inflicts more damage when the user's HP is high.

Waterfall.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Waterfall turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 160.
Waterfall.detailed_effect:
Waterfall deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Wave Crash.detailed_effect: Wave Crash deals damage, but the user receives 1/3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
Wave Crash.secondary_effect: User receives 1/3rd of damage in re-coil.

Weather Ball.effect: Move's power and type changes with the weather.
Weather Ball.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Weather Ball turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 160.
Weather Ball.detailed_effect:
The power and type of Weather Ball changes with the weather. With no weather condition it is Normal and has a base power of 50. If a weather condition is in effect, its power doubles to 100 and the move becomes a different type:

Weather Ball will receive STAB where appropriate - for example by Vanilluxe during a hailstorm, or Castform during sun, rain or hail since it transforms into the appropriate type.

In sun and rain, the power of Weather Ball will gain an additional 50% power because Fire- and Water-type moves are boosted respectively in those conditions. (Other weather conditions don't receive any type boost.)
Weather Ball.in_depth_effect: This move changes type based on the weather. In Sun it's Fire-type, in Rain it's Water-type, in Hail it's Ice-type and in Sandstorms it's Rock-type. When Dynamaxed, the Max Move also changes type accordingly so in Sun it summons Max Flare, Rain it is Max Geyser, Snow it's Max Hailstorm and Sandstorm it's Max Rockfall.
Weather Ball.secondary_effect: Changes type and doubles power based on the weather in play

Whirlpool.effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Whirlpool.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Whirlpool turns into Hydro Vortex and has base power 100.
Whirlpool.detailed_effect:
Whirlpool inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent in the vortex , causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.

If the user holds a Grip Claw , the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1/6 of the target's maximum HP.

If the opponent is hidden underwater from using Dive , Whirlpool will hit with double power.
Whirlpool.secondary_effect: Traps the opponent for 4 to 5 turns

Whirlwind.effect: In battles, the opponent switches. In the wild, the Pokémon runs.
Whirlwind.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Whirlwind turns into Z-Whirlwind and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Whirlwind.detailed_effect:
In the wild, Whirlwind blows the target Pokémon away if they are of a lower level, and the battle ends.

In trainer battles (including linked battles), Whirlwind forces the target to switch out of battle (regardless of level) and is replaced with another Pokémon in the trainer's team.

Pokémon with the ability Suction Cups or those rooted by Ingrain are not affected by Whirlwind .

Wicked Blow.effect: Always results in a critical hit and ignores stat changes.
Wicked Blow.detailed_effect: Always results in a critical hit and ignores stat changes.

Wicked Torque.detailed_effect:
Wicked Torque deals damage and has a 10% chance of putting the target to sleep.

Only the Revavroom used by Team Star has this move.

Wide Guard.effect: Protects the user's team from multi-target attacks.
Wide Guard.targets: Targets all Pokémon on the user's team.
Wide Guard.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Rockium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wide Guard turns into Z-Wide Guard and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Wide Guard.detailed_effect:
Wide Guard protects the user's team from all multi-target moves (such as Surf or Rock Slide ), for the duration of the turn. It has priority +3 so will activate before most other moves.

The accuracy of Wide Guard does not decrease if used consecutively after itself or Quick Guard . However, it does decrease the accuracy of Protect , Detect , Endure , Spiky Shield , King's Shield and Baneful Bunker by 1/3 each time it or Quick Guard is used.
Wide Guard.in_depth_effect: Wide Guard protects against multi-target moves, such as Surf & Earthquake. In addition to protecting the user, it protects all of the user's allies in battle for that turn. This effect doesn't just correspond to moves used by the opponent, but it also protects allies from damage from moves by other allies which would inadvertantly damage them, such as Surf which hits all neighbouring Pokémon. This move if used in succession with other protection moves has its success rate (0-1) cut with each successive use until the 7th successive use where it caps off, if unsuccessful, the move fails and the count resets. First Use: 1, Second Use: 1/3, 3rd Use: 1/9, 4th Use: 1/27, 5th Use: 1/81, 6th Use: 1/243, 7th+ Use: 1/729
Wide Guard.secondary_effect: Protects all Pokémon on your team from damage that'd hit both Pokémon for one turn

Wild Charge.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wild Charge turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 175.
Wild Charge.detailed_effect: Wild Charge deals damage, but the user receives 1/4 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 100 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 25 HP.
Wild Charge.secondary_effect: User takes recoil damage equal to 25% of the damage inflicted.

Wildbolt Storm.detailed_effect:
Wildbolt Storm deals damage and has a 20% chance of paralyzing the target. The move targets both opponents in a double battle (each with a 20% chance of paralysis).

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

If used during rain , Wildbolt Storm ignores accuracy.
Wildbolt Storm.in_depth_effect: This move increases in accuracy to 100% during rain.

Will-O-Wisp.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Firium Z and uses its Z-Power, Will-O-Wisp turns into Z-Will-O-Wisp and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Will-O-Wisp.detailed_effect:
Will-O-Wisp causes the target to become burned, if it hits. Burned Pokémon lose 1/8 of their maximum HP each turn and their Attack is decreased by 50%.

Fire type Pokémon, those with the ability Water Veil or those behind a Substitute cannot be burned.

Wing Attack.targets: Targets any single Pokémon on the field including non-adjacent ones.
Wing Attack.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Flyinium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wing Attack turns into Supersonic Skystrike and has base power 120.
Wing Attack.detailed_effect: Wing Attack deals damage with no additional effect, besides being able to hit non-adjacent Pokémon in triple battles.

Wish.effect: The user recovers HP in the following turn.
Wish.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wish turns into Z-Wish and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Wish.detailed_effect: The user recovers HP in the following turn.
Wish.secondary_effect: In 1 turn, it heals whatever Pokémon is in this position on the field's Hit Points by 50% of the maximum Hit Points.

Withdraw.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Waterium Z and uses its Z-Power, Withdraw turns into Z-Withdraw and raises Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Withdraw.detailed_effect:
Withdraw raises the user's Defense by one stage.
