Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.

Wonder Room.effect: Swaps every Pokémon's Defense and Special Defense for 5 turns.
Wonder Room.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wonder Room turns into Z-Wonder Room and raises Special Defense one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Wonder Room.detailed_effect: Wonder Room switches the Defense and Special Defense of all Pokémon in battle, for 5 turns.
Wonder Room.secondary_effect: Switches Defense & Special Defense for five turns for all Pokémon on the field

Wood Hammer.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wood Hammer turns into Bloom Doom and has base power 190.
Wood Hammer.detailed_effect: Wood Hammer deals damage, but the user receives 1/3 of the damage it inflicted in recoil. In other words, if the attack does 90 HP damage to the opponent, the user will lose 30 HP.
Wood Hammer.secondary_effect: User takes recoil damage equal to a third of the damage inflicted.

Work Up.effect: Raises user's Attack and Special Attack.
Work Up.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Work Up turns into Z-Work Up and raises Attack one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Work Up.detailed_effect:
Work Up raises the user's Attack and Special Attack by one stage each.

Stats can be raised to a maximum of +6 stages each.
Work Up.secondary_effect: Raises user's Attack & Special Attack one stage.

Worry Seed.effect: Changes the opponent's Ability to Insomnia.
Worry Seed.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Grassium Z and uses its Z-Power, Worry Seed turns into Z-Worry Seed and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Worry Seed.detailed_effect:
Worry Seed changes the target's ability to Insomnia , which prevents the Pokémon from falling asleep. If the move is used on a sleeping Pokémon, it will wake up on its next turn.

Worry Seed does not work on Pokémon with the ability Truant or Multitype .
Worry Seed.secondary_effect: Changes the opponent's ability to Insomnia

Wrap.effect: Traps opponent, damaging them for 4-5 turns.
Wrap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wrap turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 100.
Wrap.detailed_effect:
Wrap inflicts damage on the first turn then traps the opponent, causing them to lose 1/8 of their maximum HP after each turn, for 4-5 turns.

If the user holds a Grip Claw , the after-effects last for 7 turns. If a Binding Band is held, the damage is 1/6 of the target's maximum HP.

Wring Out.effect: The higher the opponent's HP, the higher the damage.
Wring Out.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Wring Out turns into Breakneck Blitz and has base power 190.
Wring Out.detailed_effect:
Wring Out inflicts more damage when the opponent's HP is higher. At full HP its base power is 120 and it decreases in proportion - i. e. the power is:

Wring Out is a Special-category counterpart move to Crush Grip . It is also similar to Water Spout and Eruption , based on the opponent rather than the user.

X-Scissor.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Buginium Z and uses its Z-Power, X-Scissor turns into Savage Spin-Out and has base power 160.
X-Scissor.detailed_effect: X-Scissor deals damage with no additional effect.

Yawn.effect: Puts opponent to sleep in the next turn.
Yawn.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Normalium Z and uses its Z-Power, Yawn turns into Z-Yawn and raises Speed one stage, in addition to its usual effect as above.
Yawn.detailed_effect:
Yawn makes the target drowsy on the turn it is used. If the target is still on the field at the end of the next turn, it falls asleep. Sleeping Pokémon cannot move (with some exceptions such as Snore ). Sleep lasts for 1-3 turns.

Pokémon with the abilities Insomnia or Vital Spirit , or those behind a Substitute cannot be put to sleep.
Yawn.secondary_effect: Target falls asleep during the next turn.

Zap Cannon.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zap Cannon turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 190.
Zap Cannon.detailed_effect:
Zap Cannon deals damage and paralyzes the target, if it hits. Paralyzed Pokémon have a 25% chance of not being able to attack, and their Speed is decreased by 50% (75% in Generations 1-6 ).

Electric type Pokémon, those with the ability Limber or those behind a Substitute cannot be paralyzed.

Zen Headbutt.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Psychium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zen Headbutt turns into Shattered Psyche and has base power 160.
Zen Headbutt.detailed_effect:
Zen Headbutt deals damage and has a 20% chance of causing the target to flinch (if the target has not yet moved).

Pokémon with the ability Inner Focus or those behind a Substitute cannot be made to flinch.

Zing Zap.z_move_effect: When a Pokémon is holding Electrium Z and uses its Z-Power, Zing Zap turns into Gigavolt Havoc and has base power 160.

Zippy Zap.effect: Always results in a critical hit.
Zippy Zap.detailed_effect:
Zippy Zap deals damage with high priority and always results in a critical hit.

Zippy Zap is a Pikachu-exclusive tutor move from Pokémon Let's Go, along with Splishy Splash and Floaty Fall .
